story:
Thank you for accepting the challenge!  The Challenge to raise awareness about brain injury in your community and beyond!


"Egg em on!" - Challenge

Help Fight the "Silent Epidemic"

Brain Injury is the leading cause of death and disability in children and young adults.  In Iowa there are more than 95,000 individuals with long term disability from brain injury.  

We are the Brain Injury Alliance of Iowa.  

  • We were founded more than 30 years ago by Iowans with brain injury and their families.
  • We maintain a team of brain injury professionals who support thousands of Iowans with brain injury to navigate the medical and social complexities of brain injury to live well with, and recover from brain injury.  
  • We support prevention and awareness efforts statewide.  
  • We educate medical and disability professional on current and emerging medical and rehabilitation techniques.
  • We have support groups and  family and caregiver education programs.
  • We are a state and federally recognized, Iowa, non-profit, charity; have an active statewide board of director and an overhead of less than 15%

Why this fundraising challenge?  

  • Survival from, and awareness of, brain injury is on the rise.  
  • Globally, the World Health Organisation predicts that TBI will become one of the leading causes of disability and death by the year 2020.
  • As a result the demand for information, services and supports has increased significantly in recent years.  
  • We are raising funds to keep up with the demand for support, services, awareness and prevention.  
  • Each caller to our toll free line ( 855-444-6443) receives customized information and support.
  • We are there for and with families, caregivers, and survivors for as long as they need us.  For some this has been for many years.
  • We were the authors of, and driving force behind, Iowa's youth sports and concussion law - we are now training coaches and teachers better understand concussion (mild brain injury) on the field and in the classroom.
  • Iowa is one of three states with no motorcycle helmet law.  We have (sadly) hundreds of stories of youth and adults who would be with us, or without long term disability from brain injury were they to have worn a helmet.  We will keep at this until Iowa comes to its senses and mandates this basic protection for its citizens.

The Impact

Brain injury is the last thing on your mind, until it is the only thing.  

  • We all have someone we know whose life has been changed by brain injury.
  • Your donation supports an organization that has been, is, and will be the voice of help, hope and healing.
  • We have a transparent and excellent track record of using public funds for our mission and in getting outcomes.  For example we have changed the landscape for high school athletes - reducing the risk that they will play with brain injury before they are recovered and supporting them as they head back to the field and classroom.  Help us extend this track record of success and excellence.  

There are and will be Challenges

We have a goal of $90,000.  Yet even ten time this amount would not be enough to meet the needs of Iowans with brain injury.

  • We have already helped leverage tens of millions of dollars in Federal and State funds to support post-acute rehabilitation, home and community based services, community based neuro-rehabilitation, and Neuro-resource facilitation.  These services have impacted tens of thousands of Iowans.
  • The need is great, but after 30 years of success we realize that not all brain injuries are preventable.  Thus we will be here for the long haul, with your support, for individuals and families that walk this road.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are other ways you can help.  Join us as a volunteer.  Spread the word about this campaign. But please, break an egg (and share the video)  for a good cause!

story:
About Monika & On Solid Ground

Monika has spent the last decade studying, practicing, implementing and teaching the tools of Yoga and Ayurveda in conjunction with Mood Disorders. This was the result of over two decades spent suffering with mood disorders and a corresponding breakdown of physical health which included living in physical pain 24/7. In 2005, after spending four debilitating years on Ontario Disability, Monika’s suicidal tendencies had developed to the point of being unbearable. The time had come to learn how to build a life worth living or give in to these tendencies. Giving in was not an option as she was the sole supporting/caregiving parent to two young children. She set out to find alternative methods to supplement the tradition, North American medical system which was not providing the relief needed to create an accessible, sustainable, self-supporting life. What she found in Yoga and Ayurveda were the tools she needed to empower herself, and others, on a holistic journey of recovery.

Over the past decade, while diligently working her own recovery process, Monika has built two small business in the fields of accounting and Yoga while creating a holistic healing/recovery blueprint. Her family physician and therapist both often comment on the tremendous transformation she has created in her life. Part of this recovery has included running a weekly Yoga class focused on helping students improve their own mental health.

This Yoga for Mental Health class is now in its sixth year. It is run by donations. Donations are appreciated but never required as financial challenges should not be a barrier to wellness in Monika’s opinion. Donations received from this class go back into providing treats and special events for this community. Students from this class have also used this information to create amazing transformations in their own lives.  Some have gone on to become Yoga teachers, others have created the health improvements necessary to return to work, many now enjoy improved relationships with family, friends and themselves! The success stories of these students include being able to complete educational goals; passing the bar exam; being able to provide familial support in times of need; volunteering in the community. In short these students have been able to build lives worth living in which their mental health challenges and symptoms have become manageable. All of this from attending weekly classes, imagine what could happen if more people could access this technology on a deeper level.

Monika has imagined exactly that with her newest venture On Solid Ground (OSG). The Mindful Living Programs at OSG are a way for students to access ten years of holistic recovery information presented in a supported way so that they too may create a personalized recovery blueprint. These programs not only help in recovery but can be used by anyone, at any time in their lives, to transform life’s struggles into a more fulfilling life experience.

Stress, burn out and mood disorders rob the experiencer of the ability to take care of self and be a contributing member of our society. Your donations will be used to help those with financial challenges access these programs not only for the betterment of their own lives but society as a whole. Thank you in advance for helping to build this mindful living community which holds space for people to find their own solid ground!


Wish List (where donations will go)

  • $855 to provide two subsidized spaces for the OSG September 2015 Mindful Living ten week program for participants who would not be able to otherwise access the program (participants will asked to contribute 10% of fees)

  • $475 to provide two subsidized spaces for the OSG September 2015 Mindful Living ten week program (participants will be asked to contribute 50% of fees)

  • $1282.50 to provide one subsidized spaces for the OSG January 2016 Mindful Living five month program (participants will be asked to contribute 10% of fees)

  • $1425 to provide one subsidized space for OSG January 2016 Mindful Living five month program (participants will be asked to contribute 50% of fees)

  • $962.50 to help cover OSG start-up costs including website domain and hosting, workbook printing, advertising, room rentals

What Contributors receive

  • $10 personal thank you card by snail or email

  • $27 personal thank you card and a space in a special one hour OSG Yoga classes that will end with treats!

  • $108 personal thank you card and a space in a special two hour OSG Introduction to Ayurveda workshop

  • $216 personal thank you card from OSG,  two spaces in a special two hour OSG Introduction to Ayurveda workshop OR a private Yoga classes at your location for up to ten people

  • $432 personal thank you card from OSG, a private Yoga class for up to 15 people OR a two hour Intro to Ayurveda workshop for up to ten people (location provided)

  • $1080 personal thank you card from OSG, thank you card/letter from sponsored participant, a private Yoga class for up to 15 people OR a two hour Intro to Ayurveda workshop for up to ten people (location provided) and corporate sponsor acknowledgement on OSG website and all OSG promotional material for a one year period

Any funds that exceed the total of this wish list will be used to create spaces in future programs as well as further research and development for expanding programs. A full breakdown of how collected monies are used will be made available to any contributor (of $108 or more) upon request. 


Other Ways You Can Help

In these challenging economic times people may wish to help yet may not have the financial means to do so. Here are a few non-financial ways you can contribute to this campaign:

  • Talk about this campaign with friends and family
  • Spread the word by sharing on Facebook or other social media
  • Check out the Indiegogo sharing tools
  • Contact Monika for printed material to post at your work
  • Volunteer to help out with one or both of the special OSG Yoga classes being offered in this campaign.

story:
OUR GOAL

Our  primary goal here is raise money to support 10 victims of Female Genital Mutilation (FGM) get reconstructive surgery next month. We need  $2040 to  provide reconstructive surgery to  the first 10 fistula patients. We are working  with one  hospital and only one surgeon to make surgery possible.  
*Please  support our patients and share the link with friends and encourage friends to contribute too.*

WHO WE ARE!

We are ICOD Action Network: welcome to Project #40Women, our project to eradicate Female Genital Mutilation and provide reconstructive surgery to 40 mothers with fistula starting with the first 10 patients this November.   Most women who develop fistula remain untreated for their entire lives.  This is why we are acting now!

WHAT IS FISTULA??  Please read more on World Health Organization's 10 facts about Obstetric fistula HERE


Our secondary goal is to raise money to open up the first solar-powered Fistula tracking centers here in East Africa. In the 14 months alone, we have reached out to  1500 girls and  women and increased the number of women accessing to maternal health services by more than 30%.  We are hopeful this number will double  if we open up these community disease tracking centers.

Our team have been tracking, managing Female Genital Mutilation and fistula cases and  supporting patients get reconstructive surgery at our partner health facility.    We took 3 of our patients for  surgery  on the weekend of Sept 4, 5 6.  Thank you all who made this possible. We'll keep you all posted on the progress.We want out to join so we can reach out to more patients

FEMALE GENITAL MUTILATION AND OBSTETRIC FISTULA

 About 140 million girls and women worldwide are currently living with the consequences of Female Genital Mutilation. Female Genital Mutilation comprises all procedures involving partial or total removal of the external female genitalia. In communities where  Female Genital Mutilation is widely practiced  it is one of the causes of obstetric fistula and urethral damage because procedures used in the practice especially among girls and women having their first deliveries.  This is the why we are working very hard to eradicate Female Genital Mutilation because its relatedness to health effects like recurrent infections, chronic pain, cysts, an inability to get pregnant, complications during childbirth and fatal bleeding. There are no known health benefits.

Setting up fistula tracking centers means we are matching  patients to treatment....better diseases control and guidance , AND promoting reproductive health in communities where health services are nonexistent or totally broken down. Our fistula tracking centers will grow into  community health-support centers  addressing several community healthy issues like malaria and children immunization campaigns. 


To treat fistula and provide women with follow-up medical care, we need to know more about how many women and girls are in need of services and also where they live. In most instances, stigma forces women living with the condition to remain hidden and isolates them from families and communities. By systematically registering and tracking each woman and girl who has or had an obstetric fistula, we can make enormous strides in improving their well-being. This is what makes our Fistula tracking centers are important addressing women's health issues.

The centers  will be operated by our partner organization and will be just like any other ordinary field office like the one in the picture below: A laptop, printer, files to record patients bio data, a digital camera, an internet modem,  first aid kits, two solar panel and batteries, chairs and  tables for clerks and staff . These centers will be hubs for innovations in  communities and we will periodically share data and findings with partners and supporters. 


HOW DOES THE WORLD STAND TO BENEFIT FROM THIS?

 Project #40Women is a community asset. We are opening fistula  tracking centers for use by other partners , activists and individuals advocating for similar maternal heath issues. Innovations like internet  and Telemedicine will allow us to extend training and consultation between our team and maternal health consultant . We are gaining positive traction with local and international women health  activists worldwide. As we move forward with our mission, we trust that we will  build more collaborations. We see this as an enormous opportunity to build a global community that shares knowledge in both directions that will reduce suffering  of fistula patients worldwide.

LOCATION OF OUR FISTULA TRACKING CENTERS

HOW DID OUR STORY BEGIN?

Our journey began on April 15 2014 when our team started filming an FGM short film called Chasing The CUT.  Our film did not only capture real-life stories about FGM victims across the region but also  opened our hearts and minds to eradicate Female Genital Mutilation and other women rights abuses. This inspired us to start our Northeastern Uganda Reproductive health program which includes  eradicating FGM, reconstructive surgery for fistula patients and training  grassroots organizations to lead maternal health activities in their localities. Watch trailer below



WHY IS IT NOW THE RIGHT TIME TO ERADICATE FISTULA?

Over 2 million women worldwide have an obstetric fistula, with the majority of cases occurring in resource-poor countries like here in Uganda, East Africa.  Most obstetric fistulas are surgically correctable.

This crowdfunding campaign  adds greatly to our ability to track and support more women get reconstructive surgery  and make it a priority in our health care system.

Project #40Women  finds opportunity in the mismatch between the demand for maternal health services and expertise and its limited availability. By supporting existing community-based resources like community disease tracking centers, we are increasing capacity through a “hub and spoke” response model. We are the hub, health care providers and patients are the spokes.


LET'S MAKE IT HAPPEN

Project#40Women is about building 'Action Networks' that empower people taking ownership of their lives and getting  healthcare system vital to improving their lives.  If we create a vibrant "action network' through this crowdfunding campaign, we are very sure we will make be able to reach out to hundreds of girls and women. 

We cannot spark this paradigm shift alone. This project is about including YOU in the movement to improve lives of women and girls in communities where basic health services are non-existent or completely broken down. 

Our team will :

  • Provide services
  • Develop partnerships
  • Evolve working administrative structures that support the mission 
  • Make our entire reproductive health program  more sustainable
Below is what this crowdfunding campaign will fund:

First, Project #40Women  is seeking $2040 to  provide reconstructive surgery to  the first 10 of the 40 fistula patients . 
Second, $726 will be used to buy 6  big water proof medical boxes that also include first aid kits. (This includes shipping to East Africa)
$2880 will allow us to bring on a part-time counselor and one Telemedicine consultant  that will further amplify our efforts to provide health support and counseling to our  patients.

This funding goal will enable us to achieve our minimum viable fulfillment of initial set up, staffing and technology infrastructure. 

As a second Stretch Goal,  $2400 will be used to buy solar panels, batteries, a printers,  digital cameras  and laptops for all the centers .


$204  is the cost of one-time fistula reconstructive surgery here in Uganda. However some extreme cases may require surgery twice or thrice.  This an incredibly cost effective project; Funds raised here will directly go to paying for reconstructive surgery of patients  and provide post-surgery healing support to patients.


This campaign constitutes only a portion of our overall long-term strategic budget. Our stripped down funding goal represents the minimum that we need to begin implementing our plan to reach out to hundreds of fistula patients. We trust that we will be able to reach this goal due to support from visionaries like you.

DO WE HAVE A HISTORY OF PIONEERING COMMUNITY SOLAR CENTERS IN UGANDA?

YES, in 2010, we opened up Uganda's first solar-powered internet  cafe for rural  farmers. Watch video and see how we did it with our Chicago partners, Project Focus


PERKS

We  are so grateful for Project Focus who sent us a bag-full of postcards, posters, button badges  from Chicago in May.  We have them here so we are not incurring any cost to get gits for our contributors.


MEET MARY, OUR TRACKING TEAM MEMBER?

I  have continuously been inspired by what we have achieved over the one year. It brings me such happiness that I could be part of something so … amazing. So thank you. So much. For giving love, family and friends to those who are just trying so hard to be true to themselves.  Thank you for upholding women's values and what we stand for.  You are my heroes.” - Mary



Our team expects a dramatic increase  in our capacity to meet the growing demand  maternal health services in  communities where we work. Supported by a medical consultant we shall offer consultation remotely where specialty women health services are lacking.

Our mission here is to rebuild lives of 40 of women broken down by Fistula.  This campaign will help us start with the fist 10 patients.  We also want our staff to grow to include a nurse and a counselor as the necessary resources become available.


OUR THEORY OF CHANGE



THIS IS HOW WE MAKE THINGS WORK!

At ICOD Action Network , we believe that solutions can come from anyone, anywhere but lasting solutions are got when ideas are grown from within communities. Our unique approaches like Barefoot Grannies have helped build grassroots activists for maternal health, girl-child education, women rights and brought incredible results to their communities. Project #40Women is another example of how we are continuously  self-sustaining and heather communities.
We have a history of working with and supporting the evolution of small grassroots organizations as key means of developing sustainable local capacity. Our work has impacted more than 100,000 people since 2008.


BEYOND MONEY - WE NEED YOUR HELP SPREADING THE WORD

We are a grassroots organization driven by staff and volunteers who work hard everyday to ensure our works  creates lasting change in  communities we work. We don't have PR team. When you donate or read our campaign, please help us spread the work and encourage friends to contribute.

  • See all those buttons to the left of our video? When you click on those to share our campaign with others, it gets the word out and it gives us better placement on Indiegogo.

    After you try the social media, you can also use the e-mail button to share with someone personally.

  • Stay connected through our website, facebook or this campaign's twitter page. Please send us feedback on how to improve our work or if you prefer to contact us directly on how to support our work, contact nationaloffice@icodan.org / info@icodan.org
    Thank-you for support!

OTHER IMPORTANT LINKS
Our website: http://www.icodan.org
More facts about Female Genital Mutilation: http://www.icodan.org/fgm.html
Our Barefoot Grannies movement: http://www.icodan.org/barefootactivism.html Please visit our website here

need to begin implementing our plan to reach out to hundreds of fistula patients. We trust that we will be able to reach this goal due to support from visionaries like you. 
DO WE HAVE A HISTORY OF PIONEERING COMMUNITY SOLAR CENTERS IN UGANDA?YES, in 2010, we opened up Uganda's first solar-powered internet  cafe for rural  farmers. Watch video and see how we did it with our Chicago partners, Project Focus



PERKS

We  are so grateful for Project Focus who sent us a bag-full of postcards, posters, button badges  from Chicago in May.  We have them here so we are not incurring any cost to get gits for our contributors. 


MEET MARY, OUR TRACKING TEAM MEMBER?
I  have continuously been inspired by what we have achieved over the one year. It brings me such happiness
that I could be part of something so … amazing. So thank you. So much. For
giving love, family and friends to those who are just trying so hard to be true
to themselves.  Thank you for upholding women's values and what we stand for.  You
are my heroes.” - Mary 


Our team expects a dramatic increase  in our capacity to meet the growing 
demand  maternal health services in  communities where we work. Supported by a medical consultant we shall offer consultation 
remotely where specialty women health services are lacking.Our 
mission here is to rebuild lives of 40 of women broken down by Fistula.  This campaign will help us start with the fist 10 patients. 
We also want our staff to grow to include a nurse and a counselor as the 
necessary resources become available.
OUR THEORY OF CHANGE

THIS IS HOW WE MAKE THINGS WORK!At
ICOD Action Network , we believe that solutions can come from anyone, anywhere but lasting solutions are got when ideas are grown from within communities. Our unique approaches like Barefoot Grannies have helped build grassroots activists for maternal health, girl-child education, women rights and brought incredible results to their communities. Project #40Women is another example of how we are continuously  self-sustaining and heather communities.We have a history of working with and supporting
the evolution of small grassroots organizations as key means of developing
sustainable local capacity. Our work has impacted more than 100,000 people
since 2008.




BEYOND MONEY - WE NEED YOUR HELP SPREADING THE WORD
We are a grassroots organization driven by staff and volunteers who
 work
 hard
everyday to ensure our works  creates lasting change in  communities we 
work. We don't have PR team. When you donate or read our campaign, 
please
 help us spread the work and encourage friends to contribute. 

See all those buttons to the left of our video? When you click on those 
to share our campaign with others, it gets the word out and it gives us 
better placement on Indiegogo.
After you try the social media, you can also use the e-mail button to share with someone personally.


Stay connected through our website, facebook or
this campaign's twitter page. Please send us feedback on how to
improve our work or if you prefer to contact us directly on how to support our
work, contact nationaloffice@icodan.org / info@icodan.org
Thank-you for support!
   

OTHER IMPORTANT LINKS 
Our website: http://www.icodan.org
More facts about Female Genital Mutilation: http://www.icodan.org/fgm.html
Our Barefoot Grannies movement: http://www.icodan.org/barefootactivism.html 
Please visit our website here

story:
"Turned Dirty" - A Ceramic Sex-Toy Studio. 

If you google them (later!), you'll find it difficult to find a selection of ceramic sex toys. There's maybe one decent range, the costs are high and they're industrially produced. Everything considered, there's a demand for high quality, bespoke, eco-friendly and safe toys that's just not being filled.*

My name is Michael Burrell and, together with a little help from my friends, I want to set up "Turned Dirty," a small-scale studio that works with customers to produce their New Favourite Toy using high quality clay, my personal expertise and their own personal designs and creativity! 

I have a BA (International) in Fine Art and several years experience in Ceramics and mould-making. I've pulled pints, sold cardboard boxes door-to-door and fundraised for charity but I'm tired of the 9-5 and want to deploy my skills as a business that I hope to grow, employing more talented British and international craftspeople in turn. 

I want to give people something they'll love, delivering high-quality, eco-friendly sex-toys to boys and girls around the world. 

Bulletpoints! I love 'em!

  • High-strength stoneware and porcelain. Toys can be dropped, transported and played with without fear of breakage. 
  • Hygienic, non-porous glazes make for easy hand-cleaning. Great for sharing. The silk-smooth surface takes any lube without absorption.
  • In addition to a "standard" range, custom services will be available allowing customers to tailor that perfect texture and size. The tiny to the colossal, with almost any and every texture to your specification. 
  • Each toy is hand-painted with coloured glazes. Every toy is a unique piece of art. Custom colours, patterns, house sigils, celebrity portraits, mystic runes - the sky is the limit. 
  • Hollow with a long-life silicone stopper, Ceramic toys are perfect for heat play. Fill with hot or cold water (just like your favourite mug) and enjoy long-lasting temperature sensations. 
  • Green. So, so green. With electric kilns and responsibly sourced clay, you can lay yourself down safe in the knowledge that your pleasure isn't killing the planet. 
Admittedly, this is my first venture so there's a lot to learn. But I'm passionate, skilled and have a great vision for what I want my studio to be and what I want to give to people. 
Please help me, Internet. You're my only hope. 

* All puns are totally intentional. XD

What We Need & What You Get

At the most basic level, I need to pay the rent on my current (very excellent) open studio turningearthceramics.co.uk here in sunny Hackney, London. Their space comes at a good price but it's over £2,000 for a year. For the time being, until I can afford to get my own, independent studio up and running, I'll at least need that £2,000 to keep this process going. 
Aditionally, I need raw materials. Working efficiently at a minimum workload, my materials costs are at least £700. Increased demand will force this cost up, of course, but once we reach that stage the materials will pay for themselves. Until then, I need a little extra to keep me in raw clay until R&D is finished and the product line is ready to roll! 
Perks. Ah. Perks. 
  • Well, for £100 of funding, I'll have your pick of the line sent anywhere in the world for free (pro boner). 
  • For £200, you can send me your dream design and I'll make it into a long-lasting reality. Again, internationally shipped if needs be. That, and I'll throw in any of standard line for free. 
  • For £500, you can come visit my studio and get really hands-on in making your perfect toy. Any size, style and colour. You sit there with a cuppa and I'll build it before your eyes. That, and I'll throw in any two of the standard line for free. 
  • For £1000, as above but with the whole range thrown in and (and!) I'll make you a lovely tea set of your design (teapot, two cups, two saucers).
  • Alternatively, if you're into funding craftspeople working locally but don't actually want the toys (not everyone's cup of tea) then we can easily work out some custom ceramic perks based on your level of support. Pots, plates and bowls are all possible, or maybe you'd like something for the wall? Drop me a line: I have a lot of experience with fine sculpture.  
These are the most unique funding perks you'll find anywhere. The perfect gift, or treat! 
If I don't reach my entire goal, no worries! Any funds will be responsibly used to pay my rent and material costs, hopefully letting me reach the end of R&D and getting product out there to be sold. Even enough to buy my next coffee means so much when building a business from scratch. 

The Impact

This project will have value to anyone who likes their toys (you'd be surprised) and wants to support high quality, independent producers. If you like art objects, the pretties and/or things inside your holes - then this is the campaign for you! 
Every contribution, however small, has huge impact on my ability to make and to get production to a self-sustaining level. I have the passion and the ideas, you have the money; Let's work something out and fill every sockdraw in the land with something beautiful and unique. 

When a link to my website gets posted on your Facebook wall, just think - you could have all the bragging rights. Be one of the cool kids and buy me a cup of tea. :) 

Risks & Challenges

In the name of total transparency I'll admit I don't have any professional ceramic experience (Although, I only know a handful of exceptional people who do and I have several of them on-hand to give me advice).
I've five years of Art School under my belt, so I hope that's enough. The R&D phase is throwing up all kinds of fun creative and business challenges that I've had to take into consideration but it's only now that I have most of the large kinks sorted am I coming to you for help - I know what I've got to do and I need just under £3,000 to get there.

I hope to keep this fundraising page updated with my progress over the 40 days with pictures and videos of my work. Totally transparent, totally dedicated to beautiful, fun objects. 

F.A.Q.

"Won't it break?"
Is your vagina/anus a hammer? No? Well then. 

But seriously, this is high-strength material specially shaped for maximum toughness. Of course you should always check your toys are clean and without signs of cracking before use but otherwise they should outlive you, your children and your children's children if they're kept away from hammers, vices, sudden extreme temperature changes and multi-storey falls. If you've ever used a glass toy, you know what the deal is. 
"How custom is custom?"
Moving parts are out, but other than that I'm up for any challenge. (Hopefully expanding into vibration technology later!)
"You're a man. You know nothing about vaginas/anuses!"


I'm also a fully grown human being with a lot of hands-on experience with a whole bunch of orifices. Luckily, I've also got a lot of people (including my lovely girlfriend) on side to help me with design work and deal with the very real practicalities of putting things into yourself. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your girlfriends. Tell your boyfriends. Tell me ideas you have that you want made into amazing toys! There're going to be the prettiest pictures. real soon.

story:
Every year over 1 million children die because of
gastrointestinal infections.


Together we can save them. Support the Ls, help these babies!


"In the third world every day 4,000 children die as a result of lack of drinking water" Helvetas
“Water is one of the earth’s most precious and threatened resources. Health is one of each person’s most precious resources. […]” World Health Organization


Poor hygiene and lack of adequate instruments for sterilization are among the leading causes of death in the third world and war zones. The existing instruments for sterilization are often useless due to unavailability of sources of energy or chemicals. Our innovative patent turns a baby bottle into a sterilizer for water that does not require electricity, gas nor chemicals.




Let's start from the beginning


Once upon a time … A coffee bar, a table, two drinks and a napkin. The little napkin they give you when they serve you a few snacks. Usually during conversations, that napkin transforms in something disgusting: usually a little oily ball, sometimes a mountains of splinters, occasionnally you scribble all over it. That evening there was no space left for oily balls, splinters or random lines…

That evening, in Lausanne, we started to draw on it…

...we drown the skeleton of a dream : a world where also little children born in less lucky areas of the world could have the opportunity to live their lives, play, grow up, without being afraid of getting sick because of dirty water and the micro-organisms in it. What a young intern and a entrepreneur could do to outline a smile on these children’s face? That evening we started to sketch our Ls prototype, and our project made the first little step.

We didn’t have much money, so we contacted some friends, some of whom where engineers, film-makers, photographers, and …mothers. 

Together we joined our experiences and our knowledge and we made it. A functioning autosterilizing baby bottle with its safe nipple, tested for the first time in our small garden in Bissone and, after a series of laboratory tests, officially patented.

Two years later we’re here, on a crowd funding platform, and we need you to help us making a bigger step toward a better world. A world where water will return being a source of life instead of a source of disease.


What is our present stage of development


We have patented a system consisting of a simple double threaded cylinder and a valve (specifically calibrated) mounted on an hermetic tank that when exposed to hight temperature, sterilizes both the water contained in it and the teat without chemicals or filters.

We deposited a European patent and the international patent is pending.


The design of the prototype we used to test effectiveness of our patented system, is unpolished. We wanted to focus on functioning more than look and this not-so-good-looking prototype made the job.

Indeed, we used it to run several lab tests and got exceptional results!

After months of researches we are ready to put the final product into production. It will not differ from the first prototype in anything but the shape, re-designed to be child-friendly and manageable.

Engineers and mold makers worked together to develop an effective and yet ergonomic product for our brilliant system which is now ready to be industrialized.

Today, our baby bottle is ready, we have collected data and refined our project. 

Today we need you! We need you to give us the kick-off to enable us to launch the production and make our dream real.

 

What we ask of you


Our goal is to create a handy and economical solution, which we trust could save millions of lives. 

With your help we want to obtain all the necessary certifications to start right away the production and be ready to deliver starting from October 2016.

In April 2016 we will produce a small amount of early production of our baby bottles (200 pieces) and test the project in a selected location during a period of 1 month length over a cluster of 200 children. With the support of a medical equip we will be demonstrate the reduction of specific viruses and bacteria and the consequent improvement of health among children. 

In this period, we will shoot a documentary film of our expedition and create a photographic book to make the world aware of our project and to rise awareness and sympathy towards one of the main problems that affects poorer countries.

What we ask of you is to believe in The Ls by participating in our dream today ad tomorrow we will be able to say:

 "We have saved a life!"


The Ls baby bottle: Lab Experiment

Biologist prof.Luca Paltrinieri, via Aprica 30 – 6900 Lugano, CH


Materials

•  Petri dish Culture

•  Medium TBX Agar Culture 

•  Medium Std Agar 

•  Microfilter 0.45 um 

•  Small sterile material 

•  Pump for vacuum extraction 

•  Sewer water 

•  Bunsen burner 

•  The Ls baby bottle 

 Method

We have verified the presence of bacteria in untreated versus treated water (the latest was obtained after putting the baby-bottle on the Bunsen burner, waiting until the valve whistled and then keeping the temperature of 281.3 ° F and pressure of 3.5 Bar 2 more minutes, see instructions below)

We have performed three types of tests on both the untreated and treated water : 

•   1ml of water was distributed over the already hardened culture medium  

•  1 ml of water was mixed with liquid culture medium before hardening  

•  100ml of water passed through the microfilter by means of the vacuum pump 


 Moreover we verified both types of culture media with the purpose of verifying the effectiveness of the treatment. 

Water and teat put through the baby bottle's treatment experienced complete sterilization. 

There were no bacteria growing in culture media where the water was poured and the teat was rubbed after the treatment by the Ls.

from left to right Petri Dish before and after treatment (water)

from left to right Petri Dish before and after treatment (microfilter 0,45 um)

from left to right Petri Dish before and after treatment (teat)

The experiment was a complete success!!!

He has said:

" Participate actively in the creation of this valuable project to help these two young researchers , Mauro and Shairin , to realize their dream , it was for me an enriching opportunity . Great it was the excitement when we saw together , the results of our experiments .These have demonstrated the effectiveness of the baby bottle : water and teat contaminated by bacteria , even dangerous , treated through the system, have been effectively sterilized. In fact , on Petri dishes nothing has grew from the water coming from the baby bottle and from the teat after sterilization. The experiment is then settled. I'm sure this product will save many young and helpless lives. For sure , I will support this project in the future" Prof. Luca Paltrinieri



Five things to Know


1. The Background

  "The number of victims caused by improper use of milk powder every month is equivalent to that caused by the explosion of the bomb dropped on Hiroshima in 1945" James Grant, Executive Director of UNICEF

This century has seen breastfeeding being replaced by the baby feeding bottle in most of the Third World countries due to advertising campaigns that made it a symbol of progress. Still, the lack of hygiene often turns this progress into an health hazard. The water is often polluted and impossible to sterilize due to inadequate education and resources. As a matter of fact, the standard for sterilization is 20 minutes at a temperature of 249,8 ° F and a pressure of 2 bar. The inevitable consequences are fatal intestinal infections and even death.


2. How it works

Safely feeding a child by using our baby bottle is easier than you might think.

•  Unscrew the cap and remove the double thread cylinder from the tank

•  Fill the tank with the water at your disposal 

•  Put the cap and the double thread cylinder in sterilizing position (with the nipple facing inwards) 

•  Place the baby bottle filled with water on a flame 

•  When the valve start whistling wait 2 minutes 

•  Remove the baby bottle from the flame 

•  Wait for the baby bottle to cool down to approximately 100 ° F (about 15 mins after you have removed it from the flame) 

•  Remove the cap and unscrew the double thread cylinder 

•  Add the milk powder in the baby bottle 

• Screw in the double thread cylinder in working position (with the nipple facing outwards) and shake 

Serve! 


 3. Our App 

Along with the baby bottles we want to create a software that guarantees our transparency and your participation. We believe this project is yours too, and your trust as our partners, is what we're striving to win. That is why we are developing an App that allowes the community to: 

•  Monitor the development and production of the Ls on a step-by-step basis 

•  Be constantly informed of all distribution agreements concerning the Ls project in a timely manner 

•  Track each purchased Ls through an identification number to know the final destination of every piece 

•  Connect with other supporters, joining a community free to interact in a provided common space 


 4. The Name Contest 

Without your support this dream will never become a reality which is why we want this baby bottle to be yours too. As our partners we want to engage you in our decisions, starting from the name of the newborn Ls. Once the App will be ready, we'd like you to join our "name contest" by sharing with the community your pick. 



 5. A little effort for huge results 

We wanted to do something more than just dreaming and here we are, from a sketch on a tissue to Indiegogo! How terrific!! This is a great step forward but the journey is still long. But, one step after the other we are going to make it! Huge results don't necessary demand huge efforts. If we stick together we can achieve the goal as a group. With the cost of a few little things, we could all save a life.


Who we are


Mauro Gazzelli

Mauro was born in Italy the 20th of march 1978. 

He studied Marketing and Management at the Università della Svizzera Italiana of Lugano and has been working as a Manager in several companies before devoting his life to catch his dream.

Shairin Sihabdeen

Shairin, Sri-Lankan from her father's side and Swiss from her mother's, was born in Switzerland the 21th of January 1988. 

She studied Medicine at the Université de Lausanne and today she works as Medical Intern at the Ospedale Civico of Lugano (EOC).


Our Dream


Everyone has a dream… Of flying to the moon, writing a book, get promoted, travel around the world, get married, try bungee jumping, become a ballet dancer or win an Ironman Triathlon... What we would like to try, in our own small way, is to save a life… Or maybe a couple of lives… Why not a whole village or more? It stands on you. 

We’ve patented a baby bottle that can help children, born in the poorest areas of the world, to live better and longer. 

And it works!


Questions & Answers


1) How do the baby bottle exactly works?

The LS allows the water contained in it and its container to reach 281,3°F thanks to its graduated valve. At that temperature the water becomes free from micro-organisms that usually are responsible of gastrointestinal infections that frequently cause death among children, especially the unweaned one.

The double screwed cylinder keeps the nipple inside to be sterilized as well, which is a revolutionnary detail that prevents the child to ANY contact with contaminated parts.

2) Is the baby bottle dangerous? 

No! Thank to the safety valve the baby bottle is safe. If the valve ever breaks, the temperature reached will be maximum 212°F, at that  point the behavior of the baby bottle would be as dangerous as a simple boiling pot on the kitchen fire.

3) How do we understand that the water is ready?

The valve will allows air to escape once the right temperature is reached. So basically we know that the water is ready when we hear or see the vapor escaping from the valve…Exactly like a Moka Bialetti!

4) Do the baby bottle changes colour?

No, because we decided to maintain it without any paint that could be dangerous for the environment. In the video it changes colour just to give a better perception of the heating process.

5) Are the components of the baby bottle dangerous for the environment?

No! The baby bottle is recyclable.

6) On which kind of heat source the baby bottle can be put?

On any heat source : a flame, a burner.

7) How much water can we put in it?

We can fill it with 300 mL, the average amount of a baby meal.

8) What happen to the micro-organisms after the sterilization process?

Because of the high temperature, the components of micro-organisms “denaturate”; it means that their structure is distroyed and they will be inactivated and no more harmful.

9) Why a clean source of water is so important? 

Because our body is composed for more than 60% of water, which is essential for survival. In underdeveloped countries water is often contaminated with micro-organisms that cause diseases like gastroenteritis which lead to death because of dehydration.

10) What is the difference between this baby bottle and the others?

- It reaches sterilization of BOTTLE, WATER and NIPPLE, which are perfectly ready to use with no more danger of infections

- The temperature reached by the Ls is the one used in most laboratories to reach sterilization

- There’s no use of substances which are harmful for the health or for the nature

- It aims to reduce the incidence of diarrea and death among small children

That evening there was no space left for oily balls, splinters or random lines…That evening, in Lausanne, we started to draw on it…...we drown the skeleton of a dream : a world where also little children born in less lucky areas of the world could have the opportunity to live their lives, play, grow up, without being afraid of getting sick because of dirty water and the micro-organisms in it. That evening we started to sketch our Ls prototype, and our project made the first little step.We didn’t have much money, so we contacted some friends, some of whom where engineers, film-makers, photographers, and …mothers. Together we joined our experiences and our knowledge and we made it. A functioning autosterilizing baby bottle with its safe nipple, tested for the first time in our small garden in Bissone and, after a series of laboratory tests, officially patented.Two years later we’re here, on a crowd funding platform, and we need you to help us making a bigger step toward a better world. A world where water will return being a source of life instead of a source of disease.What is our present stage of development

We have patented a system
consisting of a simple double threaded cylinder and a valve (specifically
calibrated) mounted on an hermetic tank that when exposed to hight temperature,
sterilizes both the water contained in it and the teat without chemicals or
filters.
We deposited a European
patent and the international patent is pending.
The design of the
prototype we used to test effectiveness of our patented system, is unpolished.
We wanted to focus on functioning more than look and this not-so-good-looking
prototype made the job.
Indeed, we used it to run
several lab tests and got exceptional results!After months of researches
we are ready to put the final product into production. It will not differ from
the first prototype in anything but the shape, re-designed to be child-friendly
and manageable.Engineers and mold makers
worked together to develop an effective and yet ergonomic product for our
brilliant system which is now ready to be industrialized.
Today, our baby bottle is
ready, we have collected data and refined our project. 
Today we need you! We need
you to give us the kick-off to enable us to launch the production and make our
dream real. What we ask of youOur goal is to create a handy and economical solution, which we trust could save millions of lives. With your help we want to obtain all the necessary certifications to start right away the production and be ready to deliver starting from October 2016.In April 2016 we will produce a small amount of early production of our baby bottles (200 pieces) and test the project in a selected location during a period of 1 month length over a cluster of 200 children. With the support of a medical equip we will be demonstrate the reduction of specific viruses and bacteria and the consequent improvement of health among children. In this period, we will shoot a documentary film of our expedition and create a photographic book to make the world aware of our project and to rise awareness and sympathy towards one of the main problems that affects poorer countries.What we ask of you is to believe in The Ls by participating in our dream today ad tomorrow we will be able to say: "We have saved a life!"The Ls baby bottle: Lab ExperimentBiologist prof.Luca
Paltrinieri, via Aprica 30 – 6900 Lugano, CH
Materials
• 
Petri dish Culture
• 
Medium TBX Agar
Culture 
• 
Medium Std Agar 
• 
Microfilter 0.45 um 
• 
Small sterile
material 
• 
Pump for vacuum
extraction 
• 
Sewer water 
• 
Bunsen burner 
• 
The Ls baby bottle 
 Method
We have verified the
presence of bacteria in untreated versus treated water (the latest was obtained
after putting the baby-bottle on the Bunsen burner, waiting until the valve
whistled and then keeping the temperature of 281.3 ° F and pressure of 3.5 Bar
2 more minutes, see instructions below)
We have performed three
types of tests on both the untreated and treated water : 
• 
 1ml of water was
distributed over the already hardened culture medium  
• 
1 ml of water was mixed
with liquid culture medium before hardening  
• 
100ml of water passed through
the microfilter by means of the vacuum pump 
 Moreover we verified
both types of culture media with the purpose of verifying the effectiveness of
the treatment. Water and teat put
through the baby bottle's treatment experienced complete
sterilization. 
There were no bacteria
growing in culture media where the water was poured and the teat was rubbed
after the treatment by the Ls.from left to right
Petri Dish before and after treatment (water)from left to
right Petri Dish before and after treatment (microfilter 0,45 um)from left to right Petri
Dish before and after treatment (teat)
The experiment was a
complete success!!!
He has said:
" Participate
actively in the creation of this valuable project to help these two young
researchers , Mauro and Shairin , to realize their dream , it was for me an
enriching opportunity . Great it was the excitement when we saw together ,
the results of our experiments .These have demonstrated the effectiveness of
the baby bottle : water and teat contaminated by bacteria , even dangerous ,
treated through the system, have been effectively sterilized. In fact , on
Petri dishes nothing has grew from the water coming from the baby bottle and
from the teat after sterilization. The experiment is then settled. I'm
sure this product will save many young and helpless lives. For sure ,
I will support this project in the future" Prof. Luca Paltrinieri
Five things to Know1. The Background
  "The number
of victims caused by improper use of milk powder every month is equivalent to
that caused by the explosion of the bomb dropped on Hiroshima in 1945"
James Grant, Executive Director of UNICEF

This century has seen
breastfeeding being replaced by the baby feeding bottle in most of the Third
World countries due to advertising campaigns that made it a symbol of progress.
Still, the lack of hygiene often turns this progress into an health hazard. The
water is often polluted and impossible to sterilize due to inadequate education
and resources. As a matter of fact, the standard for sterilization is 20
minutes at a temperature of 249,8 ° F and a pressure of 2 bar. The inevitable
consequences are fatal intestinal infections and even death.
2. How it works
Safely feeding a child by
using our baby bottle is easier than you might think.
• 
Unscrew the cap and remove
the double thread cylinder from the tank
• 
Fill the tank with the
water at your disposal 
• 
Put the cap and the double
thread cylinder in sterilizing position (with the nipple facing inwards) 
• 
Place the baby bottle
filled with water on a flame 
• 
When the valve start
whistling wait 2 minutes 
• 
Remove the baby bottle
from the flame 
• 
Wait for the baby bottle
to cool down to approximately 100 ° F (about 15 mins after you have removed it
from the flame) 
• 
Remove the cap and unscrew
the double thread cylinder 
• 
Add the milk powder in the
baby bottle • Screw in the double thread cylinder in working position (with the
nipple facing outwards) and shake 
Serve!  3. Our App 
Along with the baby
bottles we want to create a software that guarantees our transparency and your
participation. We believe this project is yours too, and your trust as our
partners, is what we're striving to win. That is why we are developing an App
that allowes the community to: 
• 
Monitor the development
and production of the Ls on a step-by-step basis 
• 
Be constantly informed of
all distribution agreements concerning the Ls project in a timely manner 
• 
Track each purchased Ls
through an identification number to know the final destination of every
piece 
• 
Connect with other
supporters, joining a community free to interact in a provided common
space 


 4. The Name
Contest 
Without your support this
dream will never become a reality which is why we want this baby bottle to be
yours too. As our partners we want to engage you in our decisions, starting
from the name of the newborn Ls. Once the App will be ready, we'd like you to
join our "name contest" by sharing with the community your
pick.  5. A little effort
for huge results 
We wanted to do something
more than just dreaming and here we are, from a sketch on a tissue to Indiegogo! How terrific!! This is a great step forward but the journey is
still long. But, one step after the other we are going to make it! Huge results
don't necessary demand huge efforts. If we stick together we can achieve the
goal as a group. With the cost of a few little things, we could all save a
life.


Who we are



Mauro Gazzelli
Mauro was born in Italy the 20th of march 1978. 
He studied Marketing and Management at the Università della Svizzera Italiana of Lugano and has been working as a Manager in several companies before devoting his life to catch his dream.
Shairin Sihabdeen
Shairin, Sri-Lankan from her father's side and Swiss from her mother's, was born in Switzerland the 21th of January 1988. 
She studied Medicine at the Université de Lausanne and today she works as Medical Intern at the Ospedale Civico of Lugano (EOC).


Our Dream

Everyone has a dream… Of flying to the moon, writing a book, get promoted, travel around the world, get married, try bungee jumping, become a ballet dancer or win an Ironman Triathlon... What we would like to try, in our own small way, is to save a life… Or maybe a couple of lives… Why not a whole village or more? It stands on you. 
We’ve patented a baby bottle that can help children, born in the poorest areas of the world, to live better and longer. 
And it works!



Questions & Answers
1) How do the baby bottle exactly works?
The LS allows the water contained in it and its container to reach 281,3°F thanks to its graduated valve. At that temperature the water becomes free from micro-organisms that usually are responsible of gastrointestinal infections that frequently cause death among children, especially the unweaned one.
The double screwed cylinder keeps the nipple inside to be sterilized as well, which is a revolutionnary detail that prevents the child to ANY contact with contaminated parts.
2) Is the baby bottle dangerous? 
No! Thank to the safety valve the baby bottle is safe. If the valve ever breaks, the temperature reached will be maximum 212°F, at that  point the behavior of the baby bottle would be as dangerous as a simple boiling pot on the kitchen fire.
3) How do we understand that the water is ready?
The valve will allows air to escape once the right temperature is reached. So basically we know that the water is ready when we hear or see the vapor escaping from the valve…Exactly like a Moka Bialetti!
4) Do the baby bottle changes colour?
No, because we decided to maintain it without any paint that could be dangerous for the environment. In the video it changes colour just to give a better perception of the heating process.
5) Are the components of the baby bottle dangerous for the environment?
No! The baby bottle is recyclable.
6) On which kind of heat source the baby bottle can be put?
On any heat source : a flame, a burner.
7) How much water can we put in it?
We can fill it with 300 mL, the average amount of a baby meal.
8) What happen to the micro-organisms after the sterilization process?
Because of the high temperature, the components of micro-organisms “denaturate”; it means that their structure is distroyed and they will be inactivated and no more harmful.
9) Why a clean source of water is so important? 
Because our body is composed for more than 60% of water, which is essential for survival. In underdeveloped countries water is often contaminated with micro-organisms that cause diseases like gastroenteritis which lead to death because of dehydration.
10) What is the difference between this baby bottle and the others?
- It reaches sterilization of BOTTLE, WATER and NIPPLE, which are perfectly ready to use with no more danger of infections
- The temperature reached by the Ls is the one used in most laboratories to reach sterilization
- There’s no use of substances which are harmful for the health or for the nature
- It aims to reduce the incidence of diarrea and death among small children

story:
The funds for this campaign will be used for the following:

To develop, shoot, and air infomercials for the HXL Workout Videos for Kids and Teens to help fight a major epidemic in America today...bad health, obesity, low self-esteem and bullying.

In the age of social media healthy lifestyle and fitness have become secondary to our young generation because the lack of school funding has caused school districts across the country to cut Physical Education as well as other Healthy Lifestyle Fitness Programs. By cutting these programs there has been a severe increase in Childhood Obesity causing an increase in bullying, depression, and behavioral problems. 31.8% of children and adolescents are overweight according to the Food Research and Action Center. Today, about one in three American kids and teens is overweight or obese as stated by the Center for Disease Control. Among children today, obesity is causing a large range of health problems that previously weren’t seen until adulthood. These include high blood pressure, type 2 diabetes and elevated blood cholesterol levels. There are also psychological effects: Obese children are prone to have low self-esteem, negative body image and depression. Excess weight at young ages has been linked to higher and earlier death rates in adulthood as stated by the American Heart Association. Childhood Obesity has become such an epidemic that First Lady Michelle Obama made this statement, in her speech at the launch of her Let’s Move program…”economic experts tell us that we’re spending outrageous amounts of money treating obesity related conditions like diabetes, heart disease, and cancer. And public health experts tell us that the current generation could actually be on track to have a shorter lifespan than their parents.”

We need to teach our youth at a young age about the positives of a healthy lifestyle to give them a fair chance at being healthy. Being fit...Isn't just for the moment...It's a lifestyle! 

Shawn L. Jenkins is founder and President of Hollywood Extreme Lifestyle. Creator of the Hollywood Extreme Workout and the Hollywood Extreme Workout Program created to inspire and motivate men, women, and children to live a healthy life style. Shawn is a Body Jock, a fitness instructing phenomenon.  It is not unusual for Shawn’s clients to become so inspired from the lifestyle change that, they become certified instructors after going through his Hollywood Extreme Workout Program.  Shawn has been the Healthy Lifestyle and Fitness Consultant for Hollywood A-List, Premier Professional Athletes and Entertainers since 2000. He has worked with the likes of Mathew St. Patrick, George Stults, Darlene Ortiz, Samaki Walker, James Toney, Anthony Okungbowa, Sofia Choi, and  Ryan Browning, just to name a few. Shawn has increased his clients strength, endurance, cardio and changed many lifestyles. One client lost over 100 lbs under Shawn’s consultation in less than one year. He knows what to say and how to say it, to uplift and keep you motivated to reach your goal. Whether it's a conference or an individual Shawn L. will take you over the top. Some of his clients include Hollywood's A List, cast members of "The Ellen Show", "Six Feet Under", "Seventh Heaven", "Monsters Ball", "X-Men" and “The Debaters” to name a few. Shawn L. has advised and trained everyone from prep, collegiate, to the professional level, including PGA, NBA Stars and Heavy Weight Champ James "Lights Out" Toney. The most sought after healthy lifestyle and fitness consultant, especially by those who seek to be extreme and go over the top. Shawn L. Jenkins is the creator of the "Hollywood Extreme Workout". He believes "Being Fit Isn't Just For The Moment...It's A Lifestyle". Shawn Jenkins is the recipient of the Outstanding Membership Involvement Award, presented by the C.E.O of the YMCA of America. He has sponsored or participated in events with organizations such as YMCA, Donate Life, American Heart Foundation, AIDS Foundation, American Cancer Society, Larry King Heart Foundation, Operation Smile, Children Uniting Nations Day of the Child, and Athletes & Entertainers for Children, just to name a few. Shawn penned healthy lifestyle and fitness articles for No Strings Attached Entertainment News Magazine. The articles were educational, informative, and entertaining always giving you the incentive to take immediate action. His goal now is to send his message across the globe. www.nostringsattachedenews.com .

story:
Short Summary

Nana Chatzi was born in Serres in 1943 and grew up in Thessaloniki. 

In 1969, she immigrated to Germany and lived there for six years. During these years, Nana went on with her transition as there was more support and possibilities to help her accomplish this goal.

In 1975 Nana returns to Thessaloniki, Greece. Eventually, she became active amongst trans women and LGBT rights groups. Today, she is an active member of S.Y.D. (Greek Transgendered Association) and Homophonia (Thessaloniki’s Pride Festival). Up until this day, she still fights for LGBTQI rights.

In 2015 Nana was sadly diagnosed with two different types of lung cancer.

As a trans woman in current Greek society, she is struggling under the broken Department of Health. She receives the minimum monthly amount of social benefits from the Greek government.

With this campaign we want to raise funds to help Nana with her medical costs that involve chemotherapy, medication and daily home care. With your help, Nana can have good medical support and the personal care she really needs!

Who we are: We are a group of LGBTQI people from Greece who have come together in order to show solidarity to Nana and help her during this difficult time.

What We Need & What You Get

1800 euros for 5 hours daily care for three months (house and hospital) treatment.

600 euros for medical patches that reduce pain which will last for two months (not covered by health insurance)

600 euro for additional medical costs (bandages, mobility aids, complementary therapies)

In order to save extra costs, our unique perk is our eternal gratitude and love.

If the entire goal is not reached, the funds will cover Nana's most urgent needs, such as medicine and daily care.

    The Impact

    Nana Hatzi has been an activist for LGBTQI rights since the 70's. She took part in panel discussions and workshops on trans rights, she has been a member of the human rights department of left wing organisations, participated in the first trans pageant in 1980 and co-organised the Thessaloniki Pride since 2012 as member of Homophonia.

    Earlier this year, the feature documentary NANA by Lara Kristen was released, documenting her life story. The film is a way for us to learn herstory through storytelling, observation and archive material that shows trans issues and difficulties in Greek daily reality.

    This campaign is the first greater attempt coming from the Greek LGBTQI community to support a single person in need. This has been a powerful and inspirational experience. With your help, we hope to contribute to this cause.

    Groups creating this campaign:

    Proud Seniors (https://www.facebook.com/groups/ProudSeniors/)
    Outview Film Festival (http://outview.gr/cms/en)

    Other Groups that showed their solidarity: 
    Rainbow Families (http://ouraniotoksofamilies.blogspot.gr/)
    Independent collectives
    and Friends

    Risks & Challenges

    We are aware of the fact that many people from our LGBTQI community find themselves in precarious situations and with this campaign we hope to set the beginning for a greater international movement that raises awareness and supports more individuals and marginalised groups.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We understand that not everybody has the funds to support our campaign, but you can help us by sharing this on your social media and with your friends. You won't just be helping a person in need within a broken health system, but you will also be raising awareness on trans issues in the Greek daily reality.

story:
WHAT IS TEAM VACCINE ALL ABOUT?

Have you ever had a feeling that an idea is too big for your own two hands? Have you spent hours on end brainstorming different ways to transform that idea into a reality? You may have struggled to assemble a group of people with the same passion or been troubled by the uncertainty of finding the manpower required to make a change. For us, the inspiration occurred in a Vaccine Preventable Diseases course where four driven individuals found what we needed to make a difference… We found a team.

TEAM VACCINE is a fundraising organization created by four students who are passionate about promoting health and vaccine awareness across our local and global communities. We have all been a part of a team, either past or present, which has lead us to understand the importance of effective communication of accurate information. TEAM VACCINE was created in order to provide access to health and vaccine-related facts that students, parents, athletes, and the general public can refer to.  The money we raise will serve to aid and promote the importance of vaccine awareness worldwide.


OUR MISSION:

As a team of students with a common goal, we strive to provide the public with consistent and valid information concerning vaccine health and safety.  Additionally, we aim to raise money to enhance access and delivery of vaccines and other health-promoting products to both children and adults in need.  We believe the lessons and knowledge we have acquired through working with healthcare professionals will enable TEAM VACCINE to effectively assist in efforts toward eradicating disease, alleviating poverty, and challenging other healthcare professionals to do the same. With the help of friends, family, and our communities  around the world, TOGETHER, we can achieve our goal.


DONATE:

Your donations will contribute to the following areas of vaccine awareness & development:

  • Local Aid:   
-Mom’s Clinic in Hamden High school in Hamden, CT (operated by the Quinnipiack Valley Health District) provides Hep B and HPV (GARDASIL) vaccines. 

                                       

-  Columbus House Inc. homeless shelter in New Haven, CT

                                                    

  • Global Aid:   

-  Contributions will be donated to Shot@Life, a campaign of the UN foundation.

-  Shot@Life divides supportive funding among GAVI the Vaccine Alliance, World Health Organization: WHO, and The United Nations Children’s Fund: UNICEF

o For $20, Shot@Life provides immunizations that focus on: measles, polio, pneumococcal, and rotavirus vaccines, which will provide a child with a lifetime of immunity from these deadly and debilitating diseases.  


                         

                                       



STORE:

Bracelets: 


T-Shirt Logo: 



TEAM VACCINE would like to thank you for your support! We greatly appreciate your generous contributions to a great cause. If you have any questions or concerns please do not hesitate to contact us.  
THANK YOU!

Children’s Fund: UNICEFo For $20, Shot@Life provides immunizations that focus on: measles, polio, pneumococcal, and rotavirus vaccines, which will provide a child with a lifetime of immunity from these deadly and debilitating diseases.                                                                  STORE:

Bracelets: T-Shirt Logo: TEAM VACCINE would like to thank you for your support! We greatly appreciate your generous contributions to a great cause. If you have any questions or concerns please do not hesitate to contact us.  THANK YOU!

story:
About The Cookbook

 

For those looking for a bit of motivation, inspiration, delish food and energy for your life, Eat For Life! cookbook offers up delicious shakes and silky smoothies, salads, sandwiches, and soulfully delicious lunchtime meals, with easy to read recipes.  In additional to all that goodness, the cookbook also offers great tips on packing wholesome meals for your family and for those who live their life on the go. Eat For Life is full of how to tips for saving time and money in the kitchen with meal prepping, and weekly meal plans and nutritional food parings that will keep you on a healthy track.

Most of the Eat For Life! cookbook is complete (including the recipes and food shots). However we need you to help push us over the top for completion.

 

With your support, Eat For Life! cookbook fans will learn and discover 3 main themes:

How to cook healthy, quick and soulfully delicious lunchtime (anytime) meals for home and on the go.

How to use flavor as tool to bridge the gap between the foods you enjoy and supplementary nutrient rich foods that feed you for life.

How to use protein shakes and smoothies to fight hunger while building a strong body and mind

 

The Impact

Your support of this project will help:

  • Provide a high quality cookbook for the world to experience how they to can enjoy healthy foods without scarifying flavor.
  • Enrich people’s lives by providing them with a tool for better health.
  • Provide a healthful channel and interactive platform for those who are looking to make healthy changes for life.
  • Support for the Eat For Life Kids! Project in to teach basic cooking skills and nutrition in high-risk communities.

 

 

What Your Support Covers:

 

The goal of $11,100 will cover:  

Food Photography Shoots and Locations

Professional full color printed copies of the cookbook

E-book creation and conversion

Marketing tools to get the word out about the cookbook (website development etc.)

 

 

You can  support this campaign by being an advocate for the Eat For Life! movement.  Here is how you can help:

 

Use the Indiegogo share tool and tell your family and friends about this campaign

Follow Chef Kenny on Twitter:https://twitter.com/chefkennyusa

Follow Chef Kenny Minor on facebook: https://www.facebook.com/chefkennynyc

Follow Chef Kenny Minor on Instagram: http://www.iphoneogram.com/u/201236173

 

And that's all there is to it and we appreciate the support!

 

 

About Me

I’m a Washington D.C native currently living in New York City; Truly I’m a foodie at heart and enjoy exercising as a tool for better health. The Eat For Life Kids! Project is my life’s work, teaching kids basic cooking and nutrition. I've spent the last five years developing eat for life as a culinary and lifestyle moment that celebrates flavor through the power of nutrition.

I had the opportunity to share my brand with millions through Television appearances such as Food Networks series “Chopped” also national and local news organizations. In 2014 I was awarded Ebony magazines “Top Chef Foodie Award “ for best new chef and truly feel blessed that I get to do the work I love.

 

The thought that inspires this cookbook is my belief that we all need a little help from time to time. Together we’re stronger as we inspire and support each other to commit to healthier ways of eating through education and diet.

Thank you for taking the time to read this, I hope you take the next step and support this delicious vision.

 

 

Kenny

story:
Short Summary

Pause! Look around!

Can you think of something where mechanical properties (stiffness, softness) are irrelevant?

Then, why not try understanding the mechanical properties of cells/tissues of a human body. They might be indicative of something important. Let's not ignore the mechanical properties of the cells. They might reveal things better!

But, are there tools that can actually do mechanical testing of biological cells??  

At BendFlex, we have spent more than a decade developing tools that will help us understand mechanical properties of biological cells and tissues (Check out a video here!). The tools include micro-scale grippers, micro-scale stretchers, ultra-sensitive force sensors among others.  These tools are results of a novel design paradigm called compliant mechanisms. We come from Prof. G. K. Ananthasuresh's M2D2 lab at the Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore, who is one of the pioneers of this field. Also, we have clinicians advising us on helping make this world a better place!

We believe, understanding mechanical properties of cells will be beneficial in revealing more information than what existing diagnostics can. 

We are convinced. If you too are, then kindly support our initiative

What we need

We are raising $750,000. This project is capital intensive, and a significant amount of the funding would go into procuring instruments and setting up our lab. Also, this project needs one to conduct a number of trials before it’s efficacy is established, and the techniques becomes robust. A overview of the split of the utilization of the money is captured in the image below:  

As a first step, using these funds we shall develop tools that would enhance in-vitro fertilization. We have identified solving this problem is one of the key milestone because the specimen that are part of the process are precious and cannot be subjected any kind of chemical tests. Currently, apart from inspecting the cells visually to access its quality there are no better alternatives. This is a tailor-made case for our technology that is minimally invasive, and chemical-free.

In about 18 months, we will have the World's First minimally-invasive, chemical-free compliant tool to test cells before they are subjected to fertilization.

What you get

Perks for the Top contributor of the day (with a contribution is not less than $1000):

  • A design kit with which you can design your own compliant mechanisms! 
  • Your name will be credited in our technology promoter’s page
  • You will get a unique, structural design with your name being the load-bearing element
  • A ‘Thank You’ card having a design of a mechanism from BendFlex R & D
  • Your name will be listed on the supporters page of the technology
  • Receive newsletters on our progress

Perks for contributors more than $500:

  • Your name will be credited in the technology promoter’s page
  • You will get a unique, structural design with your name being the load-bearing element in a gripper design. For example, see below:

  • A ‘Thank You’ card having a design of a mechanism from BendFlex R &D
  • Your name will be listed on the ‘supporters page' of the technology
  • Receive newsletters on our progress

For contributors more than $ 250: 

  • Your name will be credited in the technology promoter’s page
  • A ‘thank you’ card having a design of a mechanism from BendFlex R &D
  • Name on the ‘supporters’ page of the technology
  • A thanking letter from BendFlex R&D 
  • Receive newsletters on our progress 

For contributors more than $ 100: 

  • A ‘thank you’ card having a design of a mechanism from BendFlex R &D
  • Name on the ‘supporters’ page of the technology
  • A thanking letter from BendFlex R&D
  • Receive newsletters on our progress 
For contributors more than $ 50: 
  • Your name on the ‘supporters’ page of the technology
  • A thanking letter from BendFlex R&D
  • Receive newsletters on our progress  
For contributors more than $10: 
  • A thanking letter from BendFlex R&D 
  • Receive newsletters on our progress
For contributors more than $ 5: 
  • Receive newsletters on our progress

Impact

Imagine a day when we could detect cancer at its very early stage. 

Chemical-free diagnostics!

We believe that the potential of our technology would bring a new era of in-vivo diagnostic testing  down to a single cell level which compares to the in-situ non-destructive testing methods of the industry. With mechanical/biophysical biomarkers emerging, alternatives to IVD that depend on difficult to manage and operate molecular versions (cold chain, shelf life, sensitive readers etc) could reach healthcare to the masses and much lower costs.

This is a very ambitious but realistic project. On the successful outcome of this project we can be more effective in diagnosing the disease-state. Distinguish healthy cells from unhealthy ones. Consider this case: during the initial phase of cancer the number of affected cells are 5 in a 1000. Because they are very few in number it is likely that we miss on detecting them when you put through bio-chemical testing. But, if you are doing diagnostics at a single-cell level then it is very unlikely that we miss out these affected cells.

The importance of understanding the mechanical properties of cells, and tools that we have developed addressing those have been published by us in leading international journals. The publications are peer-reviewed and have won awards at different levels. We have also developed compliant mechanisms for leading med-tech companies which enabled them to understand things with a new perspective. They see a lot of future in these tools. 

Risks and Challenges

Developing tools for manipulating/handling cells needs rounds of ethical clearances before we can get a hold of human samples. Towards this, we are collaborating with clinicians who have been forthcoming in embracing our technology. As a part of the clearance we shall be demonstrating our technology with lab-mouse embryos.

The other challenging task is to fabricate these micro-scale prototypes. for this, we need a facility with microfabrication facility. Towards we are talking with our alma-mater, which has state-of-the-art nanofabrication facilities under the Center For Nano Science And Engineering.

Other ways of lending support

Spreading the word would do a world of good.
