story:
Why Movement United? 

Movement United was created in 2016 to unite the Parkour, Circus, Acroyoga, Breakdance, and Martial Arts Tricking communities in Michigan. We Believe that Uniting the Michigan Movement Community is the most beneficial thing we can do together to grow the skill level of the community, grow the # of community members, and create long-lasting friendships. We also believe learning how to master your mind and body is the single most beneficial thing you can do for self-awareness, and self-improvement.

How We Will Do It

By creating the safest, most state of the art Movement Facility in Michigan, we will continue to bring members of the community together to train with, and learn from one another! Unity is important now more than ever. Our facility is smack dab in the middle of two extremely important areas, Troy & Ann Arbor. We now have a facility, in a central location where people from Detroit, Troy, Canton, Livonia, & Ann Arbor can meet together multiple times throughout the week without driving too far or breaking the bank. Movement United has become a hub for everyone to meetup and have fun! 

 

Our Team

The Movement United team, led by a group of talented Athletes, Coaches, and Movement Artists began Building Movement United near the end of 2016. United towards the goal of providing our community with a Movement facility capable of fitting the needs of as many of our community members as possible. We believe that respect, love, and support should be given to each and every community member that walks through our door. Professionalism, safety, and proper technique is what we preach as a team. Our team teaches from experience, not theory, which we believe sets us apart and helps our students learn efficiently.


What Your Donation Will Be Used For

We will be using the money that is raised from this Campaign to build multi-purpose Parkour & Ninja Warrior Obstacles. Obstacles that can be used for both training styles. No more running the same Parkour or Ninja Warrior course. Moveable/Changeable obstacles will be incorporated throughout the entire space to keep things fresh, and help our community members grow & progress. 

We will be releasing our Full sketchup Design of the finished layout of the Gym, which is being designed by Andy Taylor of Pinnacle Parkour Academy Philadelphia within the next two weeks. Andy has designed multiple Parkour Gyms Across the U.S.

A Customized Airtrick Mat will be designed and Bought for the gym $7500. Below is a video of one in action! Check it out!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XcwdfdOjixk&amp...

We will redesign our foam pit, and fill it with foam $11,000 , or a bag jump $17,000

http://bagjump.com/

We will reconfigure our trampoline setup, and build a tramp wall next to it! Check out the video below!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BIlZz0pQP2Q

We will also build a TON of Obstacles to finish out Movement United, Similar to these Parkour Gyms below! Check them out!

Forge Parkour in Portland, Oregon.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dUwnZikezfg&amp...

Pinnacle Parkour Academy Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g5H6U9jtYbE&amp...

Tempest Freerunning Academy North County, California

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QyByqJ_qdHE

Donate

We know together we can build this gym for the community! Please use our Indiegogo Page for all Perk based donations! If you wish to donate without receiving a Perk, Please do so athttps://www.gofundme.com/movementunited2017

Thank you for all of your support, Please Donate, Share, and Tell your Friends/Family about this campaign, If you love what we do here at Movement United, we thank you, and promise that we are doing are very best to add value to the lives of everyone we meet!

MY MOVEMENT STORY

My Story. 
When I was a young kid, I was afraid of everything, heights, spiders, rollercoasters, you name it...
I  assure you, I was afraid of it. I was going through life afraid, and I wasn't enjoying myself. The friends I had were always having so much fun, the freedom that they had was the freedom that I wanted, but I was too afraid to experience. 

But then one day I decided to change, I decided, I made the choice to stop being so afraid. I never was the kid doing the crazy stuff on the playground, but I was always envious of him or her. As I grew up I started to dissolve and demolish the fears that I had, and one day I saw Parkour...

I realized that Parkour was the physical manifestation of what I had been doing as a young teenager, it wasn't what I was physically doing, but I made the choice to step into this new found realm of freedom, and god/life/the universe opened up the pathway to lead me there.  I saw someone who was so free, they had what looked to me to be complete mastery of mind & body. It excited and inspired me so deeply, that I jumped up off the couch. turned off the tv, and ran to my computer.

I had been watching G4's Ninja Warrior. A much more heroic and noble version of what you see on American Ninja Warrior today. I will never forget the name being shouted by the Japanese announcer "Levi Meeuwenberer!!!" as it echoed through the speakers of my television. 

Levi Meeuwenberg a Professional Freerunner and Michigan native from Traverse City, flashed across the screen, he was jumping, vaulting and flipping outside and onstage next to Madonna, yes that Madonna. Levi wasn't there for the money or the fame, there was no reward for beating that course, besides self improvement & the respect of being a high level athlete. 

He was there to test himself on that course, a course that was infinitely more difficult than what you see on TV today. Levi's showreel was nothing short of amazing he was definitely a head of his time, what he was doing 10 years ago is still considered advanced today. 

Anyways, I jumped on the internet, started searching Freerunning and researched everything I could about it! 

At the time there were mostly just picture tutorials, yes at the time picture tutorials. They were the brunt of what existed and I started practicing everywhere I could. 

Less than a week later, I told some good friends of mine about Parkour. 

I told them of this new found love that I had, and what Parkour/Freerunning was. Naturally they asked me to some them what I had been practicing. I was excited, confident, and cocky, I brushed back my hair, rubbed my palms together, and attempted a lazy vault over a wooden fence, (you know one of those fences where the poles stick into a slot in the adjacent piece of wood....)

Well that day I learned a lesson I would never forget. Always check your obstacle. I went for the lazy vault, the fence post caved and I fell straight onto my @$$. My friends burst out laughing. I was now a red tomato, enflamed in pain & embarrassment. To this day I am not sure what hurt more, my body or my ego.

I picked myself up off the ground, fixed the fence, and tried again on the next spot, instantly their metaphorical ears perked up. "What is this called? That was so dope!" Parkour I answered, my self confidence restored. We all started training that day, Jack became my partner in crime. We went out from sun up til' sun down, training everywhere we could, we were 15 so we had to walk to every spot we could, doing whatever movements we could along the way. 

After 8 months or so of training my wrestling season began, winter came back into existence, and Jack joined diving. We were the class clowns back then, or at least we thought we were. We told everyone about Parkour, few joined, the "early innovators" as market research would call it, Jack fell in love with the photography side of Parkour and kept running with it, no pun intended. I was deep in the game, I was in LOVE. I was told to recruit a fellow classmate named Jesse Harrison to start training, everyone Jack & I trained had the large advantage of learning through us as coaches and didn't have to trouble shoot the things we did in the first year or so of our training. Jesse was a martial artist, and picked it up naturally. He was a great friend, team member, and training buddy for a long time. To learn flips we did private lessons at Livonia Gymnastics Academy for over a year, once a week. 

I finally quit wrestling because of my love of Parkour, and the large damper that it put on my training. I was great at wrestling, but I loved Parkour. It gave me the freedom I had been searching for my entire life. We started training harder and really pushing ourselves. One warm summer day I am driving, and I see an ad for Freedom Freerunning Academy on Facebook. I was ecstatic! A Parkour Gym in Michigan? No Way! Where is this place... I bet its somewhere far away. Soon after I realized that not only was this gym in my hometown, it was less than 2 miles away... I immediately cancelled all other plans and went there. I walked inside, met the owners, Dylan Borland & TJ Mckenzie, they had opened MI's 1st Parkour Gym. I trained for hours, ran up the warped wall my first try, and completed every handstand challenge I could think of. I was just 18 at this point. 

I was good at Parkour, this place helped lead me to greatness. Jesse & I made the "pro team" for the gym, it didn't meant that we were at professional level, we were good, but now we had a goal to train for, live up to the title we were given. After all, we were performing for the Pistons, booking other performances, and working as a team. Caleb, Eric, Jeremiah, Jesse, TJ. We were the Freedom 5. We were a great team. One day Dylan & TJ called a team meeting we were so excited, we weren't sure if we had booked another performance, or what the meeting could be for, but we couldn't have been more devastated, the gym, after only being open for a year, was closing. We had lost the lease agreement with the current landlord, and were being bought out by Foundations systems of Michigan. It was a blessing in disguise, 2 years later, our team had grown to 7 members, and we reopened as Phoenix Freerunning Academy in Livonia, MI. There are details that don't need to be discussed, but I loved Phoenix, I at the time had gone through my own rebirth, see 4 years ago on May 25th, I almost died in a horrific car accident. An accident that changed my life, temporarily shattered my psyche, and left me utterly confused, alienated, and feeling alone. 

A year goes by, its May 25th again... That night I was in the woods with my friend Mike Harp, celebrating life, we were just looking at deer, listening to the river and hanging out in the Matthaei Botanical Gardens, in Ann Arbor, it was 2am, when suddenly my phone rang, it was one of my teammates Jacob Winslow, "TJ is at U of M hospital, he was hit by a train". I was shocked. Why was this happening? How did I escape what could of been my death a year before, walk away unscathed, it was nothing short of a miracle. But why now? Why exactly a year later did TJ get hit by a train. What was he doing? How did his car get hit by a train! What an idiot! Was he trying to beat it? I was angry at him. I was angry at life, holding back tears, like I am right now as I write this to you. What were the chances of this? How did I end up less than 15 minutes away from him? Why wasn't I there? I had asked everyone to go to the beach that day, nobody went with me. TJ was with a girl in Ann Arbor, he was going bridge jumping at a popular spot. I don't know if he knew that the bridge was a railroad track for a still active amway. We showed up at the hospital, so many people were there for TJ. He was alive. What happened to him? TJ was hit, by a train, with his body... not in a car, the train more than grazed him, it sent him flying into the air and down into the river below. He was going back for a bag that he thought was full of important belongings. Camera & equipment, keys, wallet, phone, etc. 

TJ was and is an amazing athlete, but he always told us he hated rail precisions (jumping from rail to rail). Little did we know, he had a depth perception problem, how he is as amazing as of a Freerunner with a depth perception problem goes to show how good he really is. 

Anyways, last May I was working 3 jobs, I was teaching at a tumbling company, a gymnastics gym, and working as a busser/waiter, I met a man who gave me the opportunity of a lifetime, but wasn't able to provide the funding to fully build the gym. That is where you come in.  Our team at Movement United is doing our best to add value to people's lives, build this gym for the community, and successfully pursue the dream I have had since I was 17. To be a professional level Parkour/Freerunning Athlete and to own my own gym!
story_txt: Why Movement United? Movement United was created in 2016 to unite the Parkour, Circus, Acroyoga, Breakdance, and Martial Arts Tricking communities in Michigan. We Believe that Uniting the Michigan Movement Community is the most beneficial thing we can do together to grow the skill level of the community, grow the # of community members, and create long-lasting friendships. We also believe learning how to master your mind and body is the single most beneficial thing you can do for self-awareness, and self-improvement.How We Will Do It By creating the safest, most state of the art Movement Facility in Michigan, we will continue to bring members of the community together to train with, and learn from one another! Unity is important now more than ever. Our facility is smack dab in the middle of two extremely important areas, Troy & Ann Arbor. We now have a facility, in a central location where people from Detroit, Troy, Canton, Livonia, & Ann Arbor can meet together multiple times throughout the week without driving too far or breaking the bank. Movement United has become a hub for everyone to meetup and have fun!  Our TeamThe Movement United team, led by a group of talented Athletes, Coaches, and Movement Artists began Building Movement United near the end of 2016. United towards the goal of providing our community with a Movement facility capable of fitting the needs of as many of our community members as possible. We believe that respect, love, and support should be given to each and every community member that walks through our door. Professionalism, safety, and proper technique is what we preach as a team. Our team teaches from experience, not theory, which we believe sets us apart and helps our students learn efficiently.What Your Donation Will Be Used ForWe will be using the money that is raised from this Campaign to build multi-purpose Parkour & Ninja Warrior Obstacles. Obstacles that can be used for both training styles. No more running the same Parkour or Ninja Warrior course. Moveable/Changeable obstacles will be incorporated throughout the entire space to keep things fresh, and help our community members grow & progress. We will be releasing our Full sketchup Design of the finished layout of the Gym, which is being designed by Andy Taylor of Pinnacle Parkour Academy Philadelphia within the next two weeks. Andy has designed multiple Parkour Gyms Across the U.S.A Customized Airtrick Mat will be designed and Bought for the gym $7500. Below is a video of one in action! Check it out!https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XcwdfdOjixk&amp...We will redesign our foam pit, and fill it with foam $11,000 , or a bag jump $17,000http://bagjump.com/We will reconfigure our trampoline setup, and build a tramp wall next to it! Check out the video below!https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BIlZz0pQP2QWe will also build a TON of Obstacles to finish out Movement United, Similar to these Parkour Gyms below! Check them out!Forge Parkour in Portland, Oregon.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dUwnZikezfg&amp...Pinnacle Parkour Academy Philadelphia, Pennsylvaniahttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g5H6U9jtYbE&amp...Tempest Freerunning Academy North County, Californiahttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QyByqJ_qdHEDonateWe know together we can build this gym for the community! Please use our Indiegogo Page for all Perk based donations! If you wish to donate without receiving a Perk, Please do so athttps://www.gofundme.com/movementunited2017Thank you for all of your support, Please Donate, Share, and Tell your Friends/Family about this campaign, If you love what we do here at Movement United, we thank you, and promise that we are doing are very best to add value to the lives of everyone we meet!MY MOVEMENT STORYMy Story. When I was a young kid, I was afraid of everything, heights, spiders, rollercoasters, you name it...I  assure you, I was afraid of it. I was going through life afraid, and I wasn't enjoying myself. The friends I had were always having so much fun, the freedom that they had was the freedom that I wanted, but I was too afraid to experience. But then one day I decided to change, I decided, I made the choice to stop being so afraid. I never was the kid doing the crazy stuff on the playground, but I was always envious of him or her. As I grew up I started to dissolve and demolish the fears that I had, and one day I saw Parkour...I realized that Parkour was the physical manifestation of what I had been doing as a young teenager, it wasn't what I was physically doing, but I made the choice to step into this new found realm of freedom, and god/life/the universe opened up the pathway to lead me there.  I saw someone who was so free, they had what looked to me to be complete mastery of mind & body. It excited and inspired me so deeply, that I jumped up off the couch. turned off the tv, and ran to my computer.I had been watching G4's Ninja Warrior. A much more heroic and noble version of what you see on American Ninja Warrior today. I will never forget the name being shouted by the Japanese announcer "Levi Meeuwenberer!!!" as it echoed through the speakers of my television. Levi Meeuwenberg a Professional Freerunner and Michigan native from Traverse City, flashed across the screen, he was jumping, vaulting and flipping outside and onstage next to Madonna, yes that Madonna. Levi wasn't there for the money or the fame, there was no reward for beating that course, besides self improvement & the respect of being a high level athlete. He was there to test himself on that course, a course that was infinitely more difficult than what you see on TV today. Levi's showreel was nothing short of amazing he was definitely a head of his time, what he was doing 10 years ago is still considered advanced today. Anyways, I jumped on the internet, started searching Freerunning and researched everything I could about it! At the time there were mostly just picture tutorials, yes at the time picture tutorials. They were the brunt of what existed and I started practicing everywhere I could. Less than a week later, I told some good friends of mine about Parkour. I told them of this new found love that I had, and what Parkour/Freerunning was. Naturally they asked me to some them what I had been practicing. I was excited, confident, and cocky, I brushed back my hair, rubbed my palms together, and attempted a lazy vault over a wooden fence, (you know one of those fences where the poles stick into a slot in the adjacent piece of wood....)Well that day I learned a lesson I would never forget. Always check your obstacle. I went for the lazy vault, the fence post caved and I fell straight onto my @$$. My friends burst out laughing. I was now a red tomato, enflamed in pain & embarrassment. To this day I am not sure what hurt more, my body or my ego.I picked myself up off the ground, fixed the fence, and tried again on the next spot, instantly their metaphorical ears perked up. "What is this called? That was so dope!" Parkour I answered, my self confidence restored. We all started training that day, Jack became my partner in crime. We went out from sun up til' sun down, training everywhere we could, we were 15 so we had to walk to every spot we could, doing whatever movements we could along the way. After 8 months or so of training my wrestling season began, winter came back into existence, and Jack joined diving. We were the class clowns back then, or at least we thought we were. We told everyone about Parkour, few joined, the "early innovators" as market research would call it, Jack fell in love with the photography side of Parkour and kept running with it, no pun intended. I was deep in the game, I was in LOVE. I was told to recruit a fellow classmate named Jesse Harrison to start training, everyone Jack & I trained had the large advantage of learning through us as coaches and didn't have to trouble shoot the things we did in the first year or so of our training. Jesse was a martial artist, and picked it up naturally. He was a great friend, team member, and training buddy for a long time. To learn flips we did private lessons at Livonia Gymnastics Academy for over a year, once a week. I finally quit wrestling because of my love of Parkour, and the large damper that it put on my training. I was great at wrestling, but I loved Parkour. It gave me the freedom I had been searching for my entire life. We started training harder and really pushing ourselves. One warm summer day I am driving, and I see an ad for Freedom Freerunning Academy on Facebook. I was ecstatic! A Parkour Gym in Michigan? No Way! Where is this place... I bet its somewhere far away. Soon after I realized that not only was this gym in my hometown, it was less than 2 miles away... I immediately cancelled all other plans and went there. I walked inside, met the owners, Dylan Borland & TJ Mckenzie, they had opened MI's 1st Parkour Gym. I trained for hours, ran up the warped wall my first try, and completed every handstand challenge I could think of. I was just 18 at this point. I was good at Parkour, this place helped lead me to greatness. Jesse & I made the "pro team" for the gym, it didn't meant that we were at professional level, we were good, but now we had a goal to train for, live up to the title we were given. After all, we were performing for the Pistons, booking other performances, and working as a team. Caleb, Eric, Jeremiah, Jesse, TJ. We were the Freedom 5. We were a great team. One day Dylan & TJ called a team meeting we were so excited, we weren't sure if we had booked another performance, or what the meeting could be for, but we couldn't have been more devastated, the gym, after only being open for a year, was closing. We had lost the lease agreement with the current landlord, and were being bought out by Foundations systems of Michigan. It was a blessing in disguise, 2 years later, our team had grown to 7 members, and we reopened as Phoenix Freerunning Academy in Livonia, MI. There are details that don't need to be discussed, but I loved Phoenix, I at the time had gone through my own rebirth, see 4 years ago on May 25th, I almost died in a horrific car accident. An accident that changed my life, temporarily shattered my psyche, and left me utterly confused, alienated, and feeling alone. A year goes by, its May 25th again... That night I was in the woods with my friend Mike Harp, celebrating life, we were just looking at deer, listening to the river and hanging out in the Matthaei Botanical Gardens, in Ann Arbor, it was 2am, when suddenly my phone rang, it was one of my teammates Jacob Winslow, "TJ is at U of M hospital, he was hit by a train". I was shocked. Why was this happening? How did I escape what could of been my death a year before, walk away unscathed, it was nothing short of a miracle. But why now? Why exactly a year later did TJ get hit by a train. What was he doing? How did his car get hit by a train! What an idiot! Was he trying to beat it? I was angry at him. I was angry at life, holding back tears, like I am right now as I write this to you. What were the chances of this? How did I end up less than 15 minutes away from him? Why wasn't I there? I had asked everyone to go to the beach that day, nobody went with me. TJ was with a girl in Ann Arbor, he was going bridge jumping at a popular spot. I don't know if he knew that the bridge was a railroad track for a still active amway. We showed up at the hospital, so many people were there for TJ. He was alive. What happened to him? TJ was hit, by a train, with his body... not in a car, the train more than grazed him, it sent him flying into the air and down into the river below. He was going back for a bag that he thought was full of important belongings. Camera & equipment, keys, wallet, phone, etc. TJ was and is an amazing athlete, but he always told us he hated rail precisions (jumping from rail to rail). Little did we know, he had a depth perception problem, how he is as amazing as of a Freerunner with a depth perception problem goes to show how good he really is. Anyways, last May I was working 3 jobs, I was teaching at a tumbling company, a gymnastics gym, and working as a busser/waiter, I met a man who gave me the opportunity of a lifetime, but wasn't able to provide the funding to fully build the gym. That is where you come in.  Our team at Movement United is doing our best to add value to people's lives, build this gym for the community, and successfully pursue the dream I have had since I was 17. To be a professional level Parkour/Freerunning Athlete and to own my own gym!

story:
Professional Reporting & Marketing System For Traders


We've created a single tool that will allow all traders the ability to track trades, create reports, manage their business, and customize the tool for their own needs. 

If you trade stocks, bonds, futures, or forex, imagine being able to insert your own logo, track your performance against the benchmark(s) of your choice, create accounting, performance and marketing reports that look how you want and then send them with a few simple clicks.  


Already managing money for other people?  With JournalSqrd you can create reports that include business expenses, management fees, performance fees, and the platform will even allow you to send your own fund performance reports to help you to raise more capital!



How Are You Helping, And What Are You Helping With?


If you are a trader as we are, you know how challenging it can be to compete in a world full of experts and algorithmic systems.  With your contribution you will become part of our network, helping us to create tools to help every trader at every level.  Already an expert and/or algorithmic trader?  This is for you too!


Where Are We Now?


We launched the original product in 2015 as basic trade journal software. After receiving feedback from hundreds of traders all over the world, we realized traders were searching for a comprehensive tool to help them run their business and market themselves and their performance easily and professionally.  


Taking all feedback into account, we began to develop a much better tool than we had originally launched.  And now we are nearly done!  We have just a few features to add before we can launch.


Thus far we have hundreds of people signed up for our beta launch updates and even better we've had an overwhelming response from traders who would like to beta test our software.  We cannot tell you how excited we are about this!


We Are At The Finish Line!


After more than 1 and a half years of development and feedback from traders all over the globe, we are almost there!  We have just a few more features to add before our beta launch, and we need your help.  

Here is where the funding will go:

75% of every dollar we receive will go to completion of the development of the software.  

The remaining 25% will be allocated to hiring support and marketing staff for our launch.  So you will be directly contributing to economic growth.

If we don't raise the entire amount, we will continue to fight to finish the product. We've come too far to give up now, and we are passionate about what we are doing. 

When we raise the entire amount (or more) as you can see nearly all of the money will go to development.  This will be the case no matter how much money we raise.  Nearly every dollar will go towards making this the best product we can possibly make!


Check Out Our Contribution Perks

Every dollar helps, and we know it!  So if you are just interested in helping us complete our project, we are eternally grateful!  

And if you are trader (or you know someone who is) check out our different membership perk levels.  Get yourself beta access while helping to develop a great product, and stay informed along the way.

You can just be a fan, or you can lock in Gold Level Membership for extraordinary low prices for 1, 2, or 3 years.  Want to be part of a small team that helps us to choose features we add in the future?  You can do that too!  

We expect prices to increase dramatically after our launch, so be sure to lock in your membership now!




Want More Info?  Check Out Below OR Visit Our Website


Powerful Trade Journal


Easy to use, input screen shots and notes, learn from each trade.


Amazing Reporting Capabilities

Accounting, Performance & Marketing Reports, all with your own design and logo.


Easy To Use, Easy To Change Information


How Else Can You Help?

Share, share, share, by using these buttons on your left...  


Don't wish to contribute but want to help anyway?  Sign up for our launch updates www.journalsqrd.com.

Want To Know More Before You Contribute? 

Email us support@journalsqrd.com and we'll get back to you promptly.  We'd love to hear from you!  Want to know more about who is creating JournalSqrd?  You can check out the profile at the top of this page.


Thank you for checking us out!

story:
Welcome in friendship,

Thank you for considering why my life-changing book should be published very soon.

I was born in 1967, at the Northern General Hospital, Sheffield, fighting congenital heart disease. By the age of six, I was crippled with arthritis. At nine years of age, I had suffered two strokes and was diagnosed obese. Nevertheless, I overcame each and every one. My “miracle cures” were inspired by wishing.

In 1993, in Oldham, Greater Manchester, I started the first charity phone line with a pre-recorded message. I appeared in “the media” and explained how the phone line worked, because I was raising vital funds to fund a miraculous operation. The eyesight of a blind toddler was restored.

In 2009, in Sheffield, my early symptoms were consistent with a possible type 1 diabetes diagnosis. I was unaware that due to suffering an autoimmune disease as a child, I was more likely to suffer with another autoimmune disease in later life.

A respected consultant at the Northern General (which is one of the largest teaching hospitals in Europe) told me that I was the first person he’d ever seen to cure diabetes by dietary and lifestyle intervention approach, so I’ve been told that my story should offer hope to every diabetic in the world, too.

Copies of my book will be sold to help charities, communities and good causes.

I must share how I developed my deep determination to make my miraculous recoveries and change my life. Especially when I was determined to overcome the need for insulin and I developed an alternative method of treatment. Even though I’m in a miraculous position, I still advocate annual check-ups by medics.

My book could offer hope to diabetics, as well as the majority of people with a pulse. I also wanted to offer you a unique experience to make a meaningful wish, which will be read during my Candlelight Vigil for Hope, as I light a candle for you or loved one. It’s your choice what to wish for, while remembering that I’m offering hope.

Your wish is very important to me, so please leave your message with your payment receipt, send it via my Facebook page or keep it to yourself. Remember though that as a way of appreciating your wish it may be published where others can read it, so do not share things you aren’t happy for others to see. Don’t worry if you choose to keep your wish to yourself, because my friend Nick, a Pioneer Minister and Community Worker with the Methodist Church, will hopefully say a “Prayer of Hope” that will include everyone at my Candlelight Vigil for Hope.

By the way, the most famous person with Methodist roots was Nelson Mandela, I think. Therefore, I’m very happy to support Methodism, as well as the majority of faiths and beliefs. Especially as I’m still searching for where I belong.

Thank you so much, because I feel honoured and humbled that you have taken the time to consider supporting my life-changing book, which should be published during May 2017.
Thank you so much for taking the time to consider supporting my Candlelight Vigil for Hope, as well, which should take place at 13.30-14.00pm at Mount Tabor, Sheffield, Friday, February 10th, 2017.

https://www.facebook.com/PaulAntcliffeAuthor

story:
Our Story

Keeping your makeup brushes clean and maintained is an important part of your beauty routine. Improper cleaning and maintenance can create a buildup of makeup, dirt, dead skin cells and oil on bristles, which in turn can breed bacteria and even mold that cause breakouts, clogged pores, skin irritations and even infections. Improper cleaning and maintenance can cause bristles to degrade over time, while caked on makeup and debris hinders the brushes ability to effectively deposit makeup on your skin.

The idea for the carousel came about years ago after a skin care and makeup training class, where I learned that the most important thing about makeup is to keep your brushes clean. The trainer urged the class to come up with a way to store and dry brushes in a bristle-down position. The repeated motion of placing brushes in the traditional canister-type container drives dirt, makeup, debris and water further into the core of the brush where it becomes difficult to fully clean the bristles. And storing them in a drawer is just downright messy.

               

 

The next few years would produce DIY solutions of all kinds!

         

 

And after years of searching in vain for a beautiful, sturdy and functional solution, I finally decided to create my own, with the help of my siblings. For months we worked on the concept. Our tenets were threefold: 1. The device must store makeup brushes in a bristle-down position, 2. It must be convenient and easy to use and clean, and  3. It must be beautiful. And after a year, we had gone from concept to design, to engineering and finally to prototype. 

             

 

The resulting Makeup Brush Carousel (seen in prototype phase rendered in 3D printed plastic) is a Patent-Pending makeup brush holder comprised of three components: A beautiful porcelain dish serves as the base to maintain balance and stability, but also catches debris from daily brush use as well as water from weekly washings. The base features a curved lip to contain stray makeup and debris, and easy wipe-away or rinse cleaning. At the center of the base attaches a sturdy metal rod that smoothly spins for users to easily access various brushes. And finally, radiating from the central rotating rod are arms of varying lengths and different sized clips to which makeup brushes are mounted bristle-down. The clips are flexible in order to accommodate different sized brushes and for efficient, one-handed removal and stowage of each brush.

 

                           

 

 

Make The Bella Mela Makeup Brush Carousel part of your beauty and wellness ritual!

   

 

 

 

 

ABOUT US   

We are sisters Rosette Gorrez (Founder and creator) and Maya Gorrez (Co-founder), and brother Ducky Gorrez (Co-founder). The Bella Mela mission is to design, create and produce unique and beautiful solutions to ordinary problems related to health and wellness. With the initial success of our anchor product, The Makeup Brush Carousel, we aim to implement diversification of our product line with lifestyle products that address similar problems.

 

A GOOD BALANCE  

Our shared love of nature and the environment has motivated us to consider a balance between livelihood and giving back to the world that sustains us.  As part of our long-term goal, we intend to provide financial support on a regular and permanent basis to certain environmental organizations, as business grows. We believe that investing in the health of the environment is an investment in the future and ensures  the well-being of our children and future generations. 

 

WITH GRATITUDE   

The Bella Mela Makeup Brush Carousel came to fruition with the love and support of an amazing team of friends and family to whom we owe our deepest gratitude. Thank you for believing in us, and for giving so much of your time and energy!

We would like to thank all of our backers whose support will go directly towards manufacturing, and help us deliver the Carousel to the world. We look forward to delivering your Carousel to you as soon as possible! 

We are grateful to everyone who can support us or by hitting the 'Favorite' button and sharing our project on social media. We truly appreciate you support! 

Please refer to the FAQs for answers to common questions.
story_txt: Our StoryKeeping your makeup brushes clean and maintained is an important part of your beauty routine. Improper cleaning and maintenance can create a buildup of makeup, dirt, dead skin cells and oil on bristles, which in turn can breed bacteria and even mold that cause breakouts, clogged pores, skin irritations and even infections. Improper cleaning and maintenance can cause bristles to degrade over time, while caked on makeup and debris hinders the brushes ability to effectively deposit makeup on your skin.The idea for the carousel came about years ago after a skin care and makeup training class, where I learned that the most important thing about makeup is to keep your brushes clean. The trainer urged the class to come up with a way to store and dry brushes in a bristle-down position. The repeated motion of placing brushes in the traditional canister-type container drives dirt, makeup, debris and water further into the core of the brush where it becomes difficult to fully clean the bristles. And storing them in a drawer is just downright messy.                The next few years would produce DIY solutions of all kinds!          And after years of searching in vain for a beautiful, sturdy and functional solution, I finally decided to create my own, with the help of my siblings. For months we worked on the concept. Our tenets were threefold: 1. The device must store makeup brushes in a bristle-down position, 2. It must be convenient and easy to use and clean, and  3. It must be beautiful. And after a year, we had gone from concept to design, to engineering and finally to prototype.               The resulting Makeup Brush Carousel (seen in prototype phase rendered in 3D printed plastic) is a Patent-Pending makeup brush holder comprised of three components: A beautiful porcelain dish serves as the base to maintain balance and stability, but also catches debris from daily brush use as well as water from weekly washings. The base features a curved lip to contain stray makeup and debris, and easy wipe-away or rinse cleaning. At the center of the base attaches a sturdy metal rod that smoothly spins for users to easily access various brushes. And finally, radiating from the central rotating rod are arms of varying lengths and different sized clips to which makeup brushes are mounted bristle-down. The clips are flexible in order to accommodate different sized brushes and for efficient, one-handed removal and stowage of each brush.                              Make The Bella Mela Makeup Brush Carousel part of your beauty and wellness ritual!       ABOUT US   We are sisters Rosette Gorrez (Founder and creator) and Maya Gorrez (Co-founder), and brother Ducky Gorrez (Co-founder). The Bella Mela mission is to design, create and produce unique and beautiful solutions to ordinary problems related to health and wellness. With the initial success of our anchor product, The Makeup Brush Carousel, we aim to implement diversification of our product line with lifestyle products that address similar problems. A GOOD BALANCE  Our shared love of nature and the environment has motivated us to consider a balance between livelihood and giving back to the world that sustains us.  As part of our long-term goal, we intend to provide financial support on a regular and permanent basis to certain environmental organizations, as business grows. We believe that investing in the health of the environment is an investment in the future and ensures  the well-being of our children and future generations.  WITH GRATITUDE   The Bella Mela Makeup Brush Carousel came to fruition with the love and support of an amazing team of friends and family to whom we owe our deepest gratitude. Thank you for believing in us, and for giving so much of your time and energy!We would like to thank all of our backers whose support will go directly towards manufacturing, and help us deliver the Carousel to the world. We look forward to delivering your Carousel to you as soon as possible! We are grateful to everyone who can support us or by hitting the 'Favorite' button and sharing our project on social media. We truly appreciate you support! Please refer to the FAQs for answers to common questions.

story:
Short Summary

Hello everyone, My name is Milton Peralta and I am one of the owners of Elite Gym. Me and my business partner Carlos Angel are Navy Veterans that took on a big risk in acquiring Elite Gym of Brooklyn in April 2016. 

For the past 3 years we have been committed to create the best gym in Brooklyn and help the community. We successfully turned 1300 sq foot space into an amazing strength community. Our gym brought the community together and our business grew , unfortunately  the space was deteriorating and the landlord was unwilling to fix the structure which in end forced us to close down.

We decided to not give up so we leased a new location so we can make a better gym for our loyal members and also the community.

This campaign is important to me because I know how important Elite Gym is to our loyal members and the community. I want Elite Gym to be more than just a gym. I want it to be a place where it can be life changing experience .  Our youth and community need a place they enjoy coming to and make them not only healthier but feel better about themselves.

Here is a brief update:

Elite Gym is opening up its new location in Bensonhurst , Brooklyn Location. The location will be near City transportation just blocks away from the D and the N train.

The location will be 4000 square feet of space and we are working to outfit the gym and have it up and running for a soft opening the end of August.

The new address is is 1406 65th St Brooklyn NY 11219.

What We Need & What You Get

The campaign fundraiser goal is $9,000 in order to fix

-the electric lighting

-plumbing issues.

-construction

-updated equipment

Perks we will give with your donation is as follows:

Elite Gym Limited Edition Tee shirts and aparrel 

Elite Gym Memberships and apparel Bundles 

The Impact

A larger and accessible Elite Gym will inspire many to become part of a strength community. We will give back to the community with Free Open workouts , potential Student Summer strength camps , events. We are planning to have powerlifting, bodybuilding and weightlifting at the gym, with that said we would love to house some competitions whether it be sanctioned or in house. We will also have some events like we did at the Old Elite Gym

Risks & Challenges

The space needs some work but we will work hard and also fix the gym along the way like we did in the past. We anticipate a soft open a end of August but it depends on whether we will be able to get this work done in time.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that many will not be able to help with collaboration. We are humbled but honelease help get the word out to the strength community. 

Social Media is a great way to get this campaign going. Donating as little as you can will help, buying energy drinks , protein drinks , helping members join the gym or doing daily passes also help raise money 

Feedback is much appreciated let us know your thoughts

story:
Overview

Direct from the hub of innovations, Silicon Valley, comes FitLens: the smartest and most engaging fitness solution. 

With the unfortunate COVID-19 outbreak, and as more and more people in the United States and around the world are being forced to stay at home, the need for very robust and reliable fitness solutions that people can use from home has never been greater. We, at FitLens Inc., have developed patent-pending, proprietary technology that can meet the new demand. We need your support to get it to market quickly. 

 

About FitLens

FitLens is creating the world’s smartest AI Virtual Trainer leveraging machine learning, computer vision, and motion tracking. Our goal is to make exercising more engaging and fun without compromising quality or safety. We are bringing gaming and fitness into one solution. 

Our first product is a mobile application that guides users through exercises by providing instructions and real-time feedback! The mobile application will help:

--------------------------------------------------------

What is unique about us

Fitness solutions in the market today just show videos of trainers with very little to no feedback. While virtual trainers are a step in the right direction, seeing someone do the exercise and actually doing it are not the same things. 

 

Therefore, we built a solution that allows users to exercise from anywhere anytime while ensuring that the trainers can provide feedback as if they were right there with you. We are taking fitness solutions to the next level, not only by showing a trainer doing the exercises, but also by bringing the trainer to you. 

 

--------------------------------------------------------

What we are building now:

1. Challenges: viral challenges that you can take and share with others. You will be able to participate in our challenges for a chance to win prizes or create your own challenges to share with others.

Select a Challenge

Take the Challenge and Get Real-time Feedback

 

Challenge and Receive Challenges from Others

 

2. Workout Plans: building full workout plans across different areas such cardio, fat burn, lower body, upper body, strength, and core.

Workout Overview

Dark or Light Mode

3. Live Classes and Streaming: whether you want to have a 1:1 session with a trainer or participate in a live group class, our streaming service will provide a one of a kind experience for both the coaches and participants. 

 

--------------------------------------------------------

Limited Beta Release: To check our limited beta version in the Apple Appstore, click here

 

--------------------------------------------------------

What trainers are saying 

Don’t just take our word for it, see what some of the trainers and coaches are saying about FitLens

 

 

--------------------------------------------------------

Future features and applications

1. AI Voice Assistant: Interact with the FitLens app and give voice commands, while exercising, that the app can follow

 

2. Integration with Smart Watches and Wearables: Whether you are using an Apple Watch, Fitbit, or any other wearable, we will be able to integrate with it and incorporate data like heart rate, calories burned and much more

 

3. Integration with Smart Home Devices: Our solution will have the ability to integrate with smart TVs as well as smart home devices such as Facebook’s Portal, Amazon’s Eco Show, and Google’s Nest Hub 

 

4. Expanding into Therapeutic Exercises: Besides fitness, our technology can support applications in other domains such physical therapy and through the rehabilitation process

 

 

--------------------------------------------------------

What we need

Our goal is to give people access to the best personal trainers across the world regardless of the location or financial status. And we believe the FitLens app can help us reach that goal - an affordable, reliable fitness solution that is fun and easy to use.

We’ve put a lot of time and effort into making the perfect fitness solution. We’ve got our beta version ready and with the support from our early backers from this campaign, we can now go into production and share it with the world. The more we sell, the sooner we will be able to launch and make the FitLens app available to as many people as possible during this unprecedented time; which is our ultimate goal. 

This is a strictly limited offer as a reward for those who support our vision and product. All campaign supporters will also become FitLens’ VIPs and are entitled to exclusive early bird offers, including participation in future beta testing, and discounts on future accessories.

 

--------------------------------------------------------

You're in good hands

The FitLens app is being built by a very special and talented team. Our team brings together a ton of experience building and taking to market innovative products that get used by millions of consumers daily.

We hold ourselves to very high standards and strive to deliver the best or nothing. Our technology is patent-pending and our product is a game changer. We are inviting you to join us on a journey to the future and become part of our family. 

While there are risks and challenges with any business, we believe that we have put together a world-class team that can take on any challenges and mitigate risks accordingly. That being said, the biggest risk we face today is being able to raise enough funds to enable us to bring our product to market. That is why we truly appreciate your backing and support via this campaign. 

Should you not be able to support us financially, we would appreciate getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign to your network.

Thanks for the support!!!

story:
Up to 95% of skin cancer deaths are preventable if they're detected early.

Neviscope enables early detection through enhanced self-screening.

A Smartphone Picture Is Not Enough For An Accurate Doctor Consultancy.

 

 

 

 

Watch this brief video below to see how easy it is to start using neviscope. Its practically plug-n-play.

 
 

You can start scanning your suspected moles and spots and consult a dermatologist within 2 minutes.

 

 

 

 

Once you receive your Neviscope:

  1. Download the Neviscope app, available on iOS and Android.
  2. The app will educate you on the warning signs of skin cancer so you’ll know what to look out for.
  3. The app also stores a detailed archive of your images (nevi-scans).
  4. When you want a spot evaluated, submit a case and one of our certified dermatologists will review your submitted nevi-scans.
  5. The dermatologist will let you know if the mole requires an immediate biopsy, or will ask you to submit a new scan after a prescribed time period.

 

1 in 5 Americans will develop skin cancer in their lifetimes, resulting in the death of over 12,000 people every year.

 

 

 

 

The fact is that all moles should be considered dangerous until proven otherwise.  Skin cancer isn't just a problem for the elderly or fair-skinned, all ages and skin tones are susceptible.

But there's hope: early detection greatly increases chances of survival.

When you want a spot evaluated, submit a case and one of our certified dermatologists will review your submitted nevi-scans.

 

The dermatologist will let you know if the mole requires an immediate biopsy, or will ask you to submit a new scan after a prescribed time period.

 

 

 

Every 56 min, A Person Somewhere In The World Dies From Melanoma.

 

Most people don’t know that even just one birthmark could cause skin cancer.

Put off by the time and cost of visiting a dermatologist or oncologist, people choose not to deal with the problem. People lead busy lives and simply don’t see it as a priority.

 

Look after your whole family, from the comfort of your home. With Neviscope.

 

We all understand the dangerous of the sun. It’s no secret that prolonged exposure to UV rays leads to sunburn and increases the risk of skin cancer. It’s common knowledge that protecting your and your baby’s skin with sunscreen is especially important.

But did you know that many sunscreens contain chemical ingredients that may have adverse health effects for you and your little one?

 

 

That’s why we created Nevicream SPF50!

 

Its a mineral sunscreen and it is just what it sounds like — a sunscreen that uses minerals as its active ingredients. The minerals most often used are zinc oxide and titanium dioxide. Both of these ingredients occur naturally.

Mineral sunscreens are sometimes called physical sunscreens because they provide a physical barrier between your skin and the sun’s rays. Think of these minerals as millions of tiny mirrors resting on the surface of your skin, bouncing away harmful UV rays.

 

 

Nevicream contains Hydromanil, Provitamin D3, Coconut Oil & Physavie®.

 

  • Protects skin against infrared rays and visible light.
  • Captures and retains water and assimilates it into the skin in an immediate and natural way.
  • Immediate and long-lasting moisturizing action.
  • Regulation of skin desquamation.
  • Improves the sensorial properties.
  • Complementary activity: anti-aging.
  • Helps with Skin cells regeneration and repair damage; essentially upping the skin’s resilience, strengthening its barrier, and evening out tone and texture.
  • Helps to make skin smooth & soft.

 

NeviCream is great for everyone.
You, your baby, pregnant women and for coral reefs. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Our prototype is fully functional. (See project video to see neviscope in action).

Our team has been working on Neviscope since 2015, working on prototypes, trying out various materials and we have successfully found our winning candidate.

 

 

 

 

1. USB Charger & Cover.

2. LED on-and–off Button.

3. LED Light & Polarized Lens 1st set(Left & Right).

4. Main Lens 1st set.

5. LED Light & Polarized Lens 2nd set(Left & Right).

6. Main Lens 2nd set.

7. Holder.

8. Indicator for charger.

9. Cover.

______________________________________________________________________________________

 

 

7. Holder.

10. Observing hole.

11. Lens 1st set.

12. Lens 2nd set.

13. Anti-Slip Pad.

 

 

 

  • Lithium Battery: 90mha(UL)(UN38.3).
  • LED Light: 4pcs (3 x 3mm/0.5W).
  • USB Charge: 15 minutes of charging means continuous use of 30 minutes for scanning, that means it can last for weeks.
  • LED Light: automatic shut-down after its been ON for 1 minute.
  • How to clean the shell(case): You can use dry facial tissue or use dust blowing ball.
  • How to clean the lens: You can  use dust blowing ball, if too dirty, you can use cotton swabs with alcohol to clean the lens gently.

 

*It’s not recommended for the users to disassemble the product for any reason: the product can easily get damaged during the disassembly.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Hi, I am Yulianna Yussef.

Over the last 4 years, I've dedicated myself to raising awareness about Congenital Melanocytic Nevi (CMN) and skincare. I believe skincare should go beyond physical beauty and look for wellbeing and  profound health within.

 

5% of profit will be donated to the Charity Foundation for kids with skin cancer, for researches on how to cure the melanoma (more than 90% of people with melanoma are dying).

 

 

 

 

 

 

Disclaimer: Neviscope DOES NOT detect skin cancer. It helps by scanning your moles and connecting you with a certified dermatologist so you don't need to wait weeks for your appointment or have to go the doctor's clinic. You can stay home and practice social distancing.

story:
RUN Sports founder Yinka Ogunlowo lost both of his parents to illnesses before he was 30. Determined to increase his physical activity, he began looking for basketball pickup games --finding them was easier said than done.

 

Enter RUN Sports, a mobile application that helps you find “Run” (competitive basketball games) via a built-in schedule of pickup games and their locations; communicate with friends via the chat function, receive rewards for competitive play via the social gamification system, and receive up-to-the-minute sports news and scores via a ticker. 

 

With less than 50% of all high school age children getting less than 60 minutes of physical activity 7 days a week, RUN seeks to fill a motivational void. Its first goal: Digitally reinvent the basketball pickup game. 

“When I started downloading a few apps, I felt underwhelmed,” Yinka Ogunlowo, RUN Sports founder and CEO, said. “We ARE a social network. Our app harnesses social gamification to compel users to keep coming back and motivate them to play.” 

 

As part social network, part basketball competition and court finder, part social-gamification, RUN aims to connect people around the world through sports with ease. With hundreds of downloads and more than 50 at-capacity live events in 2 years, RUN has already started to make a name for itself in the basketball world. Its Instagram Live show, the RUN Up has  hosted college basketball stars Jose Alvarado, Kofi Cockburn, Ray Salnave, Ariel Edwards and more.  

 

With the money raised, we seek to complete the development of our new proprietary technology and legally protect the intellectual property.  As a show of gratitude we have including some cool perks for all who contribute.  For Ogunlowo, “Success is not only becoming the official sports social network but also bettering the lives of others.” 

Use this link to download and test The RUN App 1.0: 

 https://apps.apple.com/us/app/the-run-app-1-0/i...
story_txt: RUN Sports founder Yinka Ogunlowo lost both of his parents to illnesses before he was 30. Determined to increase his physical activity, he began looking for basketball pickup games --finding them was easier said than done. Enter RUN Sports, a mobile application that helps you find “Run” (competitive basketball games) via a built-in schedule of pickup games and their locations; communicate with friends via the chat function, receive rewards for competitive play via the social gamification system, and receive up-to-the-minute sports news and scores via a ticker.  With less than 50% of all high school age children getting less than 60 minutes of physical activity 7 days a week, RUN seeks to fill a motivational void. Its first goal: Digitally reinvent the basketball pickup game. “When I started downloading a few apps, I felt underwhelmed,” Yinka Ogunlowo, RUN Sports founder and CEO, said. “We ARE a social network. Our app harnesses social gamification to compel users to keep coming back and motivate them to play.”  As part social network, part basketball competition and court finder, part social-gamification, RUN aims to connect people around the world through sports with ease. With hundreds of downloads and more than 50 at-capacity live events in 2 years, RUN has already started to make a name for itself in the basketball world. Its Instagram Live show, the RUN Up has  hosted college basketball stars Jose Alvarado, Kofi Cockburn, Ray Salnave, Ariel Edwards and more.   With the money raised, we seek to complete the development of our new proprietary technology and legally protect the intellectual property.  As a show of gratitude we have including some cool perks for all who contribute.  For Ogunlowo, “Success is not only becoming the official sports social network but also bettering the lives of others.” Use this link to download and test The RUN App 1.0:  https://apps.apple.com/us/app/the-run-app-1-0/i...

story:
About

 

Introducing a breakthrough oral hygiene technology that is solving the #1 health problem of dogs. It's a fact that 80% of all dogs over the age of three, suffer from periodontitis (Inflammation of the gums due to tartar build-up). Without a viable solution to this tooth cleaning & inflammation problem, over time a lack or poor oral hygiene can lead to the damage of internal organs and reduce the quality of life for your pet.

 

Mira-Pet is an affordable and convenient vibration-free and silent oral hygiene solution that allows you to care for your pet's oral health at home, without the need of expensive and uncomfortable vet visits.

The Mira-Pet toothbrush utilizes ultrasound technology combined with the specially designed toothpaste to clean deeper than the gums, destroying bacteria on the plaque over the teeth and in the gum pockets. Our unique design and function allows pet owners an oral heath solution to tartar build up and inflammation prevention.

Caring for your pet's gums is vital to preventing periodontitis and prolonging their oral health. Mira-Pet cleans the upper and lower jaw area in as little as 45-60 seconds, killing bacteria and eliminating the build up of tartar formation. Preventing serious medical and cosmetic problems for your pet is now simple, affordable and painless. At present, there is no established market leader for a brush of this kind and many pet owners have been left wondering if there really is a better solution for dealing with severe periodontal problems than what has traditionally been made available. Years of research and real world testing behind Mira-Pet have confirmed that it is a product which has your pet's interests at the top of mind.

 

By supporting us, you'll help our campaign put funds into production and make Mira-Pet available to all pet owners. An effective solution for deep cleaning and tartar removal, our product is backed by an award winning developed team, who have 50 years of ultrasonic device and dental experience.

Like all devices for our pets, use positive reinforcement to introduce Mira-Pet to your dog. We recommend familiarizing your dog with the toothbrush slowly and rewarding with treats. This way, along with the silent and vibration-free design, your dog will remain calm while you clean their teeth. You can find out more about positive reinforcement here.

When comparing a standard (manual or sonic) brush for pets, professionals comment on the ineffectiveness of the standard brush in working to prevent a build up of tartar. On a secondary note, pets do not accept moving or rotating brushes, therefore making the use of a standard brush almost completely ineffective.

Mira-Pet comes with a Three-Sided interchangeable brush head for quick and more effective cleaning. At 60 million oscillations/minute, the ultrasound technology (accelerated air motion vibrations), gently cleans away bacteria from deep in the gum pockets.

 

Specifically Formulated Toothpaste

Overbrushing is a major cause of what wears down the enamel on your pet's teeth and results in irritated gums. The specifically formulated symbiotic Ultrasound toothpaste for Mira-Pet is made without any abrasive particles, thus eliminating the risk of damage to your pet's enamel. The difference in the toothpaste is in the billions of microscopic nano bubbles that are created when used in combination with air oscillations. These nano bubbles, roughly 150x thinner than a human hair, work through the smallest crevices on the enamel, clearing away any microscopic particles.

Well cared for oral health will prolong the life of your pet. A healthier dogs means a higher quality of life, less vet bills and happier dog owners. Techmira AG is committed to the development of the Mira-Pet and excited to introduce its vibration-free oral hygiene solution for your pet's perio problems.

 

Risks and challenges

No project is without risk and challenges but we try to do our absolute best to minimize them. We feel that we have done all the necessary preliminary work prior to coming to Kickstarter. We are also no strangers to ultrasound products or crowdfunding.

The Mira-Pet product that you see in the above video/photos are actual working prototypes.

With your support, we can bring Mira-Pet to pet owners around the world. We have started mass production and your contribution will help us achieve economies of scale and keep the product cost low.

We have sufficient inventory of material to manufacture several thousand units now. Beyond that, the lead time is about a month. Your strong support will give us the needed affirmation to place a larger raw materials order and start mass production earlier.

story:
CoVent-19 Challenge: Sponsor a Ventilator!

The CoVent-19 Challenge is the creation of 13 resident physicians, advisors and several sponsoring organizations who have come together to create lasting solutions to the ventilator supply crisis made infamous by the COVID-19 pandemic. As experts in mechanical ventilation and as those serving on the frontlines to treat patients impacted by COVID-19, they created the CoVent-19 Challenge to develop low-cost, rapidly manufacturable solutions to support heavily burdened modern medical facilities in the US and abroad. CoVent’s goal is to close the gap between our actual resources and those in need around the world.

  • The CoVent-19 Challenge is an open innovation 12-week Grand Challenge for engineers, innovators, designers, and makers. The Challenge launched on the GrabCAD Challenges platform on April 1, 2020.

  • The general admission round resulted in over 213 ventilator entries from 43 countries! Seven teams were invited to participate in the invite-only finalist round (details below).

  • The invited teams are receiving access to additional resources for completing their ventilator designs from experts at Stratasys, Ximedica, Valispace and Sonos, and support in developing functional prototypes, including testing platforms, test lungs, and testing protocols. 

  • The prototypes will be evaluated using a testing platform provided by ADInstruments to determine which design provides the best combination of performance against safety, reliability, manufacturability, affordability, and simplicity.

  • The final ventilator prototypes are due to CoVent on June 21st and will then be evaluated by a team of expert medical and technical panelists to select one ventilator for production.

Listen to our founder discuss the CoVent-19 Challenge on Vox Reset podcast.

CoVent Challenge Finalists

  • Baxter Ventilator- (Portland, ME), submitted by a team of educators, students, and alumni from Baxter Academy for Technology and Science.

  • CORE Vent- (Edinburgh, Scotland), submitted by Armadilla Ltd, a family-run business, who recently won the Queen’s Innovation Award.

  • InVent Pneumatic Ventilator- (San Francisco, CA, and Seattle, WA), submitted by fuseproject, a design and innovation firm, Cionic, a medical device technology company, and a mechanical engineering team from Accenture.

  • Lung Evolve-(Bogotá and Medellín, Colombia), submitted by an engineering team from the Universidad Nacional and Universidad Pontificia Bolivariana.

  • OP Vent- (Santa Clara, Palo Alto, and Mountain View, CA) submitted by a team from Nvidia, Waymo, Stanford University, and VA Palo Alto Health Care System.

  • RespiraWorks- (US and Guatemala), submitted by a global team of dozens of engineers, healthcare workers and other professionals with a focus on developing countries and low-resource communities.

  • SmithVent- (Northampton, MA), submitted by a team of Smith College engineering alumni and friends.

 

What We Can Achieve Together

The funds raised in this campaign will be used for the development and production of winning ventilators from CoVent-19 Challenge. Specific expenses include prototyping, testing, production tooling, legal, regulatory and labor expenses. In addition to significant in-kind donations from our sponsoring companies, we estimate a total pre-production budget of $250,000. We are targeting a first build production cost of $2,500 USD per ventilator, which is 10x less than prices of commercially available ICU ventilators. Future high volume builds will target a ventilator production cost of $1,000 to $1,500 USD. 

After the challenge, we are utilizing an award-winning medical device firm, Ximedica, to assist and advise on the ventilator development and help ensure compliance with all required standards prior to filing for the FDA Emergency Use Authorization.

Distribution of ventilator units will be need-based. International distribution will require recognition of the regulating body's authorization in the target country. 

We are targeting up to 250 ventilators for the first build in August 2020, prior to the expected Fall 2020 rise in COVID-19 cases. This Indiegogo campaign will be applied to pre-production costs and for sponsoring of individual ventilators that will be produced and distributed. If you are interested in sponsoring a ventilator, you can send a message that will be laser-engraved and tagged to the ventilator following production, as well as receiving a digital plaque displayed on the CoVent Challenge website for your generous contribution.

Our Sponsors

Risks & Challenges

Timelines for ventilator testing, production, and distribution may vary depending upon manufacturing challenges, parts availability, and ventilator demand. We are committed to the production and distribution of low-cost ventilators to heavily burdened hospitals in the United States and internationally as we anticipate the second peak of the COVID-19 pandemic.

We will also make the winning design files available royalty free to those around the world with the capacity and resources to manufacture the winning ventilator design.

In The Press

story:
My name is Elizabeth Stewart, Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist in San Jose, CA and Founder/President of Kingdom Family Resources, a Community based Mental Health Service. From 1990 to 2012 I worked within Silicon Valley's  Santa Clara County as well as in Tulsa Ok, providing Mental Health support and facilitating in home services to kids and families involved in the Juvenile Justice System, Department of Children and Family Services, County Mental Health Services, Drug Rehabilitation services, and Psychiatric Hospital Services. What I found to be most effective is helping families in the environment they are struggling in vs. a child coming to the office for therapy and then returning home back to the same way of family functioning. How can a child work at changing his behavior if the environment has no change? This is why doing therapy with the Family in the environment is more effective and sustainable than a child coming to the office for therapy.  Often the child would be identified as the problem vs. the problem being the problem, thus pushing the child and family further into a hole that seemed to have no hope. In 2012 Kingdom Family Resources was incorporated with our vision of "Restore a heart, Restore a family, Transform lives for a lifetime".  We are here to help families look at the problem that is infecting the family and focus on treating the infection instead of labeling the person. This campaign is vital to helping families receive this level of support together in a safe environment that will provide education, skill building, resources, and fun. Most families that are in crisis or striving to have a sense of wellness often are not able to experience healing and peace because their approach to addressing the problem is not working.  We need to help families learn how to address the "infection" in a way that decreases stress, brings relief, and allows the family to hope again. Your support will provide opportunities for families to come  away from this camp with a renewed strength and hope, and we need your support to make this happen!  This is a rare occasion where a family can receive this level of support together for a weekend -guaranteed to change the life of a family. 

                             

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need 9 sponsors to donate$440 for a family of 2 or more
  • We need 18 sponsors to donate $220 for an individual
  • We need 30 people to donate $150 towards individual or family
  • We need 50 people to donate $75 towards individual or family
  • We need 150 people to donate $ 25 towards individual and family

What you get as a result of investing in the families

  •   Tax write off
  •   Certificate of appreciation
  •  Free therapy consultation
  •  Table talk dinner with all sponsors to share how your giving supported families who attended the camp
  • Social Media shout out

The Impact

Why are we having a Therapeutic camp?

We want to be PROACTIVE and educate families about PROTECTIVE factors that can ultimately spare the next generation from repeating destructive cycles and life controlling dsyfunctions. And if the family is coming to camp with Trauma then they are at the right place to learn how to heal and move forward.

  • It's a time for families to be together in 1 setting receiving therapeutic support, education, and healing
  • It provides a time for families to refocus, regroup, and get back on track with living their best lives
  • Families that are healthy and productive are able to provide stability to the community.

60% of adults report experiencing abuse or other difficult family circumstances during
childhood. 

26% of children in the United States will witness or experience a traumatic event
before they turn four. 

Four of every 10 children in American say they experienced a physical assault during the past year, with one in 10 receiving an assault-related injury. 

1) National Center for Mental Health Promotion and Youth Violence Prevention, "Childhood Trauma and Its Effect on Healthy Development," July 2012 (http://sshs.promoteprevent.org/sites/default/fi...)

(2) JAMA Pediatrics, May 2013 (http://www.unh.edu/ccrc/pdf/05-13%20PED%20child...)

(3) Kilpatrick DG, Saunders BE. (1997). "Prevalence and Consequences of Child Victimization: Results from the National Survey of Adolescents." National Crime Victims Research and Treatment Center, Medical University of South Carolina

Risks & Challenges

Being a non profit makes us vulnerable to the opinions and perceptions of others and the truth is some may not see the value of helping families in the context of a therapeutic family camp- that's ok!  All we need to do is watch the news, and when violence, or rape, or suicide is in your neighborhood and on your block it becomes too close for comfort. And when it is happening at your house you will want the help. It is happening at someone's house today, right now! Trauma, dysfunction, and crime have been on my block and at my door and guess what- I didn't care what people thought, I just wanted HELP. KFR will keep seeking to help families and we will keep asking for financial support for the cause of family! Family is the most important investment on the earth!  Join me in helping families receive the help they need-that's what we're here to do - help!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can help share this campaign on your social media sites that would be great!

Maybe your organization can help raise funds with a bake sale 

I am also willing to come to your organization, workplace, school campus, and even church to provide Mental Health Education to help people understand the importance of addressing Mental Health, emotional, and behavioral needs.

And that's all there is to it.
