story:
Have you ever had a loved one who struggles with the morning wake up?  Have you ever had difficulties falling asleep at night?  Has someone close to you ever struggled with sleep at night due to allergies or asthma? 

1 in 4 Americans develop acute insomnia each year.  30 million suffer from chronic insomnia.  80 million suffer from sleep & wakefulness disorders. 

I’d like to talk to you about The Sensory System.  A sensory system to delight your senses.  A sensory system, with small speakers, various LED’s, atomizer, essential oil, scented wax warmer, fans, humidifier, and heating elements to create the optimum environments for --- gentle but effective wake ups, deep restorative sleep, and congestion free sleeping. 

 

Hello!  My name is Bill Cresse.  I’m a Mechanical Engineer, and I live in Boise, Idaho.  I’m on a mission for people who suffer sleep disorders. 

My mission is to end nighttime suffering & morning wakeup pain for people with insomnia, sleep disorders & wakefulness disorders.  I battled insomnia as a young adult, my big brother currently battles chronic insomnia, and other loved ones find waking up in the morning to be challenging, painful, dreaded & feared. 

In August of 2018, I started my own local small business (Cresse Product Development, LLC) focused on consumer & medical product development.  In addition to our family of shoulder pillow products for post-operative shoulder surgery patients & chronic shoulder pain sufferers, we’ve also been developing The Sensory System.  The Shoulder Pillow and The Sensory System are both critical steps in our mission to end nighttime pain & insomnia, and both support our Mantra:  Less pain, more comfort, better sleep...

Here’s an image of our very first “digital” prototype --- 

After validating product feasibility, we protected our intellectual property with a provisional patent application, i.e. patent pending.  Here’s an image of the patent drawing ---

The next step in the product development process was to create an “analog” functional prototype.  Here’s an image of the functioning prototype ---

We also developed some industrial design concepts of the fully integrated system.  Here’s a couple images of one of those industrial design concepts ---

 

               

The next stage in the product development process is to create a fully functional digital prototype, including firmware & app.  Unfortunately, we do not have the funds to do a fully functional fully digital prototype, including software.  That’s where you come in…  In order to continue our mission to end nighttime suffering & morning wakeup pain for people with insomnia, sleep disorders & wakefulness disorders, we need funding.  We need $204K in order to develop a fully functional digital prototype of the integrated system, including mobile smart phone app.  Here’s what we’ll use the funding for ---

  1. Design, development, simulation, prototyping & test of digital electronics, Printed Circuit Board (PCB), Printed Circuit Assembly (PCA), firmware, software & mobile app.  ($40K)
  2. Answering our main technical questions, including essential oil dispense, atomizer water dispense, moisture ingress, moisture egress, corrosion, wax warmer heating element, humidity chamber heating element, product compliance, acoustics, speaker specification, wireless, BLE, mobile app & pairing multiple systems).  ($80K)
  3. Soft tooling of components, including ceramic wax warmer, frame, base, essential oil reservoir & humidity chamber.  ($50K)
  4. 20% Contingency ($34K)

Here’s what we’ll accomplish with this funding (deliverables) ---

  1. All our engineering & technical questions will be answered & documented.  (Note:  Some prefer humidifiers, i.e. water heated to vapor, over atomizers, i.e. water particles created by ultrasonic vibration.)
  2. Fully designed (documented & specified), developed, simulated, prototyped & tested integrated system, including electronics, firmware, fluid dispense, heating elements, acoustics & mobile app. 
  3. Soft tooled components, including ceramic wax warmer, frame, base, oil reservoir, humidity chamber & PCB.  (Note:  Soft tooled usually means an Aluminum tool for plastic injection molded parts, which typically lasts for 10,000 shots)
  4. Minimum three (3) fully functional fully digital prototypes. 
  5. An awesome product ready for market!!!

Our timeline for this work is as follows ---

  1. Start design upon Indiegogo funding in early February (Feb. 3rd). 
  2. Acoustic, electronic, firmware, mechanical & software design & engineering commences Feb. 3rd, and concludes one month later, on March 2nd. 
  3. Commence simulation & prototyping on February 10th, concluding on March 29th. 
  4. Testing commences March 30th, concluding April 26th.  This includes testing effectiveness of “Good Morning”, “Good Night” & “Breathe Free” scripts. 
  5. We allotted for design iterations & contingency from April 27th through May 24th. 
  6. Tooling of PCB & mechanical components commences May 25th, concluding July 20th. 
  7. Tooling is done, project is complete & product is ready for market on July 20th, 5-1/2 months after funding & commencement of design. 

Risks & challenges include ---

We have identified & quoted four (4) different local design & engineering companies that have the skillset needed to help us with development of The Sensory System.  Their availability in the February timeframe is not a certainty. 

While we have many good years of applicable acoustic experience, others (e.g. Logitech’s Ultimate Ears MEGABOOM Bluetooth speaker) have already mastered portable Bluetooth speakers with great sound quality. 

We have lots of technical questions to answer (e.g. audio over Bluetooth, fluid dispense, acoustics, heating elements, etc.). 

One month for design is aggressive scheduling. 

In conclusion, please contribute to bring great sleep products (integrated system, and accessory to Bluetooth speaker) to many people who really, really need a good night’s sleep & less painful morning wakeups.  Finally, please share the link to this campaign page with your neighbors, friends, family & coworkers.  Also, don't forget Indiegogo’s share tools.  Thank you!
story_txt:
Have you ever had a loved one who struggles with the morning wake up?  Have you ever had difficulties falling asleep at night?  Has someone close to you ever struggled with sleep at night due to allergies or asthma? 1 in 4 Americans develop acute insomnia each year.  30 million suffer from chronic insomnia.  80 million suffer from sleep & wakefulness disorders. I’d like to talk to you about The Sensory System.  A sensory system to delight your senses.  A sensory system, with small speakers, various LED’s, atomizer, essential oil, scented wax warmer, fans, humidifier, and heating elements to create the optimum environments for --- gentle but effective wake ups, deep restorative sleep, and congestion free sleeping.  Hello!  My name is Bill Cresse.  I’m a Mechanical Engineer, and I live story:
TAKE CARE OF YOUR SHOES, AND THEY WILL TAKE CARE OF YOU.

We've designed the 1Bag as a minimalist bag to bring the bare essentials to your game. No matter what sport you play, and what equipment your team provides, most sports require you to bring your own shoes. So you show up with your stinky shoes hanging on your fingers.  

You take care of the skills, We'll take care of the shoes.  We designed the 1Bag to not only hold your shoes, cleats, boots (or whatever you want to call them) but to really take care of them.  A disorganized bag leads to a big stinky bag full of garbage. Neither you nor your game has room for that.

 

VENTILATED BAG

The breathable fabric allows airflow through the 1 bag allowing it to breathe easily. 

 

NATURAL SHOE DEODORIZER AND DESICCANTS

Each 1Bag comes with activated charcoal inserts that dry out the bag and help eliminate odors. You can leave them in the bag, or insert them into wet or sweaty shoes. 

 

FOR ANY SPORT WITH SPECIALIZED SHOES

The 1 bag carries just the necessities, for whatever sport you play.  Whether you are a commuter, a pick-up player, or a team member, the 1Bag has got you (and your shoes) covered.

 

MINIMAL DESIGN / MAXIMAL FUNCTION

The 1 bag is purpose-built to carry just what you need. A multitude of slim pockets are built-in to the 1 bag to fit the common items you carry with you, but you don't want to carry on to the field. Items like: Wallet, keys, phone, energy bar, water bottle.

 

POWERBANK (OPTIONAL)built-in

There are few things worse after a game or practice to come back to a phone that is as dead as you are. The custom slot holds our high-efficiency power bank to keep your device charged before, during, or after your game. A little extra charge is especially useful on the long bus rides to and from games.

story:
Biplate is a plate that's helps you loose weight by reducing the calories from your food.

Biplate's patent pending design has hundreds of oil collecting pockets and improves the health of your food without affecting the taste.

You can reduce up to 32 calories from each meal, that's roughly 90 calories a day!

 

We already opened the tooling and completed our first 200 Biplate units.

Those first 200 units were shipped to us and are already in our hands, we are shipping to media influencers and to our first 100 backers before the campaign ends. The rest of the Biplate units will be completed mid Feb.

Risks and challenges

We have completed the first 200 Biplates and tested them with different types of food, we are very happy with the feedback and results we received so far! Shipping will be handled via floship ( a leading shipping fulfillment center). We hope we tackled all issues as far as manufacturing and shipping but if any problems arise you guys will be the first to know

story:
If you wish to donate but would not like to choose a perk, please enter the amount you would like to donate in the box above CONTRIBUTE NOW and click on the contribute now button. (Please note that you should enter the figure only and not the £/$ sign)  

**With Offline donations and our Amazing fundraisers we now have over £300,000 Thank you**

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP.

A child who is diagnosed with a DIPG (Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma) brain tumour has only a few months to live.  It's a race against time to find a cure to stop this deadly condition.

No child in the world has survived this.  With Professor Steven Gill and his team we hope that we will never have to say that again.
We are close to finding a cure, please help us to fund a clinical trial.
Using the revolutionary CED technology developed by Professor Gill (Convection Enhanced Delivery system) the team are able to infuse drugs directly into the brain - to date this is the biggest problem in treating all neurological conditions, the blood-brain barrier.

Figure above Unique CED catheter system comprises implantable microcatheters and a skull anchored port which allows drugs to be repeatedly administered without the need for further surgery.

We know, with the help of brave Daisy Brooks, diagnosed with DIPG aged 6, that the system of delivering drugs directly into the tumour works.
(read more of Daisy's story at www.fundingneuro.com). 
We know David's* tumour has reduced by 90%  after just 3 rounds of infusions.
All of these treatments have been carried out experimentally and have shown signs that we are closer than ever before to finding a cure.
We know that there are a combination of drugs in the laboratory that if infused via the system could result in a cure!
We know that there are a number of children needing this treatment for any chance of survival, and that the only way this can be done is through a clinical trial.

Please help Funding Neuro to fund this trial and give these children that chance.
Together we can make a difference and beat the deadly DIPG.   
*Names have been changed

story:
Short Summary

Three of the ten most prevalent causes of mortality are lung-related illnesses. Since 2004, the Human Powered Nebulizer has been a product created by Lars Olson, associate professor and interim chair of biomedical engineering at Marquette University, to provide respiratory medical assistance to those who can not easily reach treatment.
In many countries, especially in Central America, it can take hours to travel to a medical clinic to receive the proper medical treatment. With the Human Powered Nebulizer, people can receive treatments from a trained professional in their home without worrying about using any electricity.


Over the past ten years, Lars Olson has worked with numerous engineers, completed clinical trials and a field test on the Human Powered Nebulizer. There are currently 14 nebulizers in use El Salvador with plans to expand to Guatemala. The technology and science behind the nebulizer is proven, now we just needs to funds to assemble and ship more nebulizers to those in need.
The members of this campaign are Shannen Oesterreich, Stephanie Melendrez and Dan Paulmeyer. We are seniors at Marquette University who are working with Lars Olson who is the founder of the Human Nebulizer Project and is a member of Marquette's College of Engineering.

Why We Care

During my junior and senior year of high school, I went on mission trips with my high school to Jamaica and Costa Rica respectively. On these trips, I spent time in small, rural communities such as the ones where the Human Powered Nebulizers are used. Things such as electricity and running water were considered luxuries to the members of those communities. Those trips opened my eyes to the world and the conditions that others face in meeting their most basic needs.


I witnessed firsthand the need for a product such as the Human Powered Nebulizer. This is a device that is proven and can bring real relief to those in need. Throughout my life and during my time at Marquette, I have been taught about the importance of giving back in any way that you can. I ask you just take the five minutes to learn about this project and consider helping any way you can. That can be a donation but also can be just emailing this link to a friend who is interested. Every donation helps bring relief to someone in need. Together, we can be the difference.
- Dan Paulmeyer

"Truth or dare?"
"Truth."
"What is your biggest fear?"
What is my biggest fear? I always struggled when my friends would ask this question because I was the brave one. I have no fear. Ok, maybe I have one: suffocating.
As an avid athlete, I played every sport you could play growing up - softball, cross country, volleyball, basketball, etc... I never took my own breath for granted because I knew exactly how important it was for me to function. Some may call me "wise beyond my years" for knowing that, but the actual answer lies on an experience. I remember sprinting down the basketball court to prevent my opponent from making a layup. Blackout. I couldn't breathe, and my body wasn't able to operate.
I was diagnosed with sports induced asthma, which isn't anything near to what the victims of respiratory diseases in this campaign have to deal with, but at least I could somewhat relate to their pain. 
Walking into the meeting with my team members, Lars Olson, creator of the Human Powered Nebulizer project, had a story to share and a passion to spread. I believe that all people are created equal and should have access to proper resources for survival. The fact that villages in Guatemala and El Salvador don't have access to electricity and fresh air is startling. So, we need your help. Giving a donation or sharing the story will benefit this campaign immensely. Help us help them.
-Shannen Oesterreich

When I first heard that I was going to work with the Human Powered Nebulizer Project I was immediately very excited. I've always been passionate about global health, medicine and everything that has to do with making a difference in the world. Before working on this campaign, I didn't know that 3 out of the 10 most prevalent causes of mortality are lung related. I also didn't know that the university I am currently attending was involved in such an amazing cause. It's always good to know that there are people working very hard to help those who need it most. 
Working with someone so down-to-earth like Lars and everything he is doing to advance this campaign is inspiring. Sitting in his office listening to his stories about his trips to El Salvador made me realize that there are many places who are unfortunately deprived of immediate medical attention. I can't imagine having a hard time to breathe and having to travel to a clinic for an hour or more just to get treated. The Human Powered Nebulizer is a great medical device that can help make it easier for low-income countries treat those who suffer from lung related illnesses. Imagine yourself suffering from asthma, TB or any other lung illness. Wouldn't you want medical attention right away? Together we can contribute to a healthier world. 
-Stephanie Melendrez 


What We Need & What You Get

For this campaign, we are hoping to raise $10,000 to send approximately ten nebulizers to those in need. The nebulizer has already been a proven success and the demand for them is increasing so now is time to meet that demand.
The money that is raised during this campaign will go towards building and shipping as many nebulizers as possible.
As a reward and as a sign of our appreciation for your donations, there are several perks available to our donors:
  • $5: Receive a well-deserved social media shout-out from the Marquette Engineering twitter account.
  • $15: Be rewarded with a You are Marquette poster to hang up at home, work or anywhere you want! There are only five available at the launch party.
  • $25: Become recognized on the official website for the project (hpnproject.com) for this generous donation amount.
  • $100: Be sent an exclusive podcast with project founder Lars Olson about his experiences in Central America with the Human Powered Nebulizer.
  • $500: Get a personal tour of the new Marquette Engineering building from Lars Olson with this donation.
If the campaign does not reach it's goal, the money will still be kept and go towards buying as many nebulizers as possible.

The Impact

This campaign is different from most campaigns that you see on IndieGoGo. This isn't some concept that someone has or some lofty goal. The human powered nebulizer is a real medical device that already works. The point of this campaign is to expand the reach of the nebulizers, not start a new project. This device works, now let's help more people.


Risks & Challenges

Since the nebulizers are being sent to El Salvador and Guatemala, there may be questions about how these devices get to the proper community and are put to use.
Throughout the course of this project, workers have been properly trained in each community to properly use the device. The nebulizers and local communities are also frequently visited by members of the HPN project.
Do you have any questions? We would love to answer them! Just email Lars Olson at lars.olson@marquette.edu and we will get you the answers you want!

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have the means to donate? Want to help in another way? That's great! There are several options for you:
  • Follow us on Twitter
  • Like us on Facebook
  • Show someone our video on YouTube.
  • Share this link on social media or email
  • Tell your co-workers, friends, that guy next to you on the bus and more! 

Thanks for taking time to learn about our project and we hope you will consider making a donation!

    The Impact
This campaign is different from most campaigns that you see on IndieGoGo. This isn't some concept that someone has or some lofty goal. The human powered nebulizer is a real medical device that already works. The point of this campaign is to expand the reach of the nebulizers, not start a new project. This device works, now let's help more people.




    Risks & Challenges
Since the nebulizers are being sent to El Salvador and Guatemala, there may be questions about how these devices get to the proper community and are put to use.
Throughout the course of this project, workers have been properly trained in each community to properly use the device. The nebulizers and local communities are also frequently visited by members of the HPN project.
Do you have any questions? We would love to answer them! Just email Lars Olson at lars.olson@marquette.edu and we will get you the answers you want!

    Other Ways You Can Help
Don't have the means to donate? Want to help in another way? That's great! There are several options for you:

Follow us on Twitter

Like us on Facebook

Show someone our video on YouTube.
Share this link on social media or email
Tell your co-workers, friends, that guy next to you on the bus and more! 


Thanks for taking time to learn about our project and we hope you will consider making a donation!

story:
SmartCardio is not just a wellness tracker that measures your heart rate. This device includes a lot of innovative technology and among other things it can: view your ECG analysis in real time, allow round-the-clock surveillance by cardiologists, reduce the number of electrodes by half and is completely wireless.

SmartCardio is a programmable device that is designed to monitor a person’s cardiovascular system, and provide the data online. Because cardiovascular disease is the most common cause of death (31% of all diseases or 17 million individuals yearly), SmartCardio's  goal is to diagnose potential heart disease and save lives. 

What makes the SmartCardio project so innovative and beneficial? 
  • It is a portable and stylish wellness tracker and serious medical device in one.
  • Through synthesis leads, it only needs 6 electrodes to capture a full electrocardiogram (ECG).
  • Online analysis of ECG on the server will track any change in your health, and can even predict a heart attack.
  • You will be under the constant supervision of a cardiologist.
  • Wireless electrodes are easy to use and do not hamper your movement in any way. It can work up to three months without changing batteries. 
  • You will be able to choose the people who will receive alerts. They simply install the application on their smartphones in order to be connected.



SmartCardio Wireless Electrodes

Electrodes are attached to the body. They are absolutely invisible under clothing, and completely wireless which means they will not restrict movement. Built on the lead synthesis, only 6 electrodes are needed for a full ECG.

SmartCardio Device

Receives data from the electrodes, processes them, removes the noises and transmits the finished cardiogram information to a user's smartphone.

User's Smartphone

Allows you to view the cardiogram on the screen. Further, it transmits the ECG data in real time to the server and receives the results of ECG, as well as any alerts and warnings.

SmartCardio Remote Server 

The entire burden of ECG online analysis falls onto a powerful server. Its essence is to compare obtained cardiogram analysis with a previously saved patient's ECG data, then with the help of historical data it predicts the occurrence of certain events, and evaluates the overall state of health. Results are sent to the patient, his attending doctor, and caretakers or family members.

Smartphones of observers

Anyone can be aware of the health status of their relatives and friends. It's simple, just install the free app on your smartphone.

Doctor's workplace and his smartphone

The doctor is always aware of the health status of his patients. He gets all the alerts and warnings from the server. At any time he can view a patient's ECG or browse the archived records. He can also easily and quickly make contact with the patient if needed.

Our SmartCardio device includes a hardware package in the form of a miniature wireless 12-channel electrocardiograph and a plethysmograph, as well as a software package for expert handling of incoming signals in real time. The system recognizes ECG and plethysmogram irregularities and makes an early diagnosis. A final diagnosis is completed by qualified doctors, who are cardiology specialists. The algorithms of cardiogram and plethysmogram recognition are original and previously unused. This is why it was possible to come up with such a system. The applicable algorithms may be successfully used in areas of technology which require the processing of non-stationary signals. Miniature ECG and plethysmographs are designed with modern technology to be state-of-the-art devices in the world of portable electronics, and are a part of the current direction in “digital health”, meaning that they are autonomous and completely wireless as well as integrated into the system “Machine Man”. In addition to the fact that continuous health control is ensured, SmartCardio is very comfortable to use. In case of an emergency, the system automatically notifies all participants of the emergency, and qualified physicians can connect to help determine the diagnosis.

  • Dimensions of the device 45 X 60 X 9 mm
  • Weight 30 g
  • Battery is LiPo 3,6 V 750mA
  • Battery Operating Time up to 7 days of continuous recording
  • Input voltage range of 0.03 to 400 mV
  • AC and isolines drift filters
  • Frequency response 0,05-1500 Hz (-3 dB)
  • Noise level <7 mV
  • Voltage Tolerance +500 mV

SmartCardio consists of the following components:

1. Single-chip module cardiograms. The base module -mikroskhema ADS1293, which comprises all of the nodes for the 12-channel electrocardiograph. Three integrated instrumentation amplifiers biopotentials and three 24 bit analog-to-digital converters, and all nodes filter defibrillator protection circuit blocks and synchronization generator for transmitting data to a central processor.

2. The central CPU cycles. Apply ARM processor STM32F103, with a speed of 72 MIPS. Main features: receiving digital stream of data, writing data to the on-board memory, organization of data to remote storage and analysis of cardiograms.  

3. Bluetooth module. Used for wireless data transfer to a smartphone, tablet or PC with the appropriate software application.

4. The memory module. Stostoit of chip flash memory capacity, and a small memory card. Depending on the functional use of use of these memory modules.

5. The accelerometer. The main purpose is to monitor the stationary patient. The second function-acts like a panic button, being set into motion by the accelerometer.

6. Display. The display consists of three LEDs for operation modes: the  cardiographs and one LED to indicate operation of the internal charger. Sound indication of the different aspects of the device is performed by the piezo buzzer.

7. Data Transfer. There are wireless connections and a USB connector for rapid data transfer of large volumes.

8. Battery. Integrated lithium-polymer battery capacity of 750 mAh. The amount of battery capacity allows the device to work at least one week in Holter-monitor mode, and at least one month in the online monitor.

SmartCardio is an innovative project. No similar product has wireless electrodes and synthesis leads. And no one system is able to analyze cardiograms in online mode and warn of a potential heart attack or stroke. 

We have a great team, each with extensive experience in implementing large projects. We are well past the idea stage and have completed the mobile app with a functioning SmartCardio prototype. Testing ECG analysis algorithm shows excellent results. Accuracy forecasts is now over 80%.

We are currently testing the system as a whole with a total of 6 electrodes instead of 12 to get a full cardiogram and transfer it to the device prototype. This information is then sent to the server, which analyzes the ECG and sends the result back to the patient’s smartphone.

- Can I use the wireless electrodes from SmartCardio with another cardiograph?

Yes. For this purpose the BLE receives signals from the electrodes with a standard connector. This comes by default.

- How can the electrodes work without replacing the battery?

By using BLE technologies, electrodes can operate up to three months without battery replacement.

- How long does the device last without recharging?

One battery charge is sufficient to operate the device for up to seven days.

- My mom lives in another state, can I monitor the state of her health?

Yes. No matter how far away from your parents, even if you are in a different country, you can safeguard the people you love. You are always the first to know if something is wrong with them.

- How long does the processing and analysis of the ECG take on the server?

Only a few seconds! As the number of users increases, so will the load on the server. We will track the load on the server and, if necessary, increase its capacity.

- Will I be able to view a previously recorded ECG?

Yes. All ECG data is stored in the file on the server. You can access them through the 'Personal Area' at any time.

- If the hospital says that a patient must wear a Holter monitor, can I still use SmartCardio?

Yes. The device has a built-in SmartCardio memory card that is enough to record the ECG for up to five days.  

- What does the subscription include?

Subscription is a set of online services, including ECG analysis. Also, part of this money will go to pay for the services of your doctor.

- What is the mobile application of SmartCardio?

Mobile application сonsists of two portions differing in their functionality. The first part is installed on the smartphone carrier device, the second on the smartphone of a doctor. The relationship between them is established through the server.

Most of the time the application is running in the background, similar to the service Skype offers. The user will only receive alerts and warnings. the device provides automatic authorization when you run the application and starts automatically after you restart your smartphone.

- How much will the mobile app?

It will be free, so it is possible to install it without purchasing the cardiograph. In this case, the application will contain information about the project and links, registration will only be available for the control group. To register, the user needs a license key from the device. Registration and application performance is not possible without an internet connection and communication with the server. This mode is available only for an in-depth analysis of the ECG of the carrier.

- How do I invite someone to a group of observation?

You will be able to send an SMS invitation to selected people from your contact list.

- Which mobile platform will support the SmartCardio application?

The application will be available for all popular platforms. Namely, iOS, Android and Windows Phone.

- If I do not have health problems, how can I use SmartCardio?

SmartCardio is useful for today's young people with an active lifestyle who want to be aware of their health. Besides, just because you do not feel unwell, doesn't mean you are not at risk. That is why heart disease is called the silent killer.

- Can I contact a doctor on the account?

Yes. At any time. With a quick phone call, SMS message or alert on his smartphone.

- What are the ways to send an alarm signal?

The alarm can be sent via the application or device which is received by all observers, including the doctor, who will immediately contact you.

- How can you prevent a heart attack?

Knowing in advance of the occurrence of a heart attack is enough to take medicine to avoid it.

- What is the synthesis of a lead?

It is the task of converting lead electrocardiographic systems, as well as their reconstruction and synthesis on a reduced set of ECG leads. The experimental results confirm the possibility of converting the ECG signal of one system's leads to another (for example, EASI ECG-12), as well as the recovery of missing historical data and distorted ECG leads with sufficient accuracy.

- What types of alerts are provided on a device?

The SmartCardio device is equipped with a means of indicating functions, both sound and light, indicating the status of the cardiograph as it is working, and alarms and signals during  functional operation of the device.

Color indicators:

* The device on / off;

* Battery level (perhaps overlapping with the first indicator);

* Health status (whether there is a warning);

* Established a connection with your smartphone.

Sound notification when:

* A match of the ECG diagnosis from the database of the device;

* Admission ECG analysis zero (the unit is on, but it is not operating properly or having trouble);

* The battery is low.

- What is the role of the server?

The server organizes communication between the functional part of the support and the control group.

Contains the most comprehensive database of diagnoses, so it can carry out a full analysis of the captured ECG. 

Also keeps an archived record of ECGs for all registered users.

Is necessary to provide a very high load, and therefore requires optimization of all processes.

- How does the analysis of the ECG work?

SmartCardio involves the development of new audio format different from all existing based on Bezier curves. Bezier curves previously found the most widely used computer-aided design and computer graphics programs. But such an innovative approach to the digitization of sound can be revolutionary in this field, just as at one time made a new way of representing objects and images - vector graphics changed the industry.

The most important quality of the new format:

* The possibility of a qualitative rather than a quantitative analysis, as in audio formats, based on the works of Fourier;

* Scalability. Quality can be stored for any length;

* The possibility of synthesizing any curve.

SmartCardio will use a new audio format for recording and analyzing the sounds of the heart muscle. Thus, it is closely linked to the cardiologist. It is will allow real-time tracking of the health of the user.

- If I have a deviation will the device constantly be sending me notifications about it?

No. Alerts and warnings will come only if we find a deviation from the model of your ECG, which will be recorded in the standby state. It will be stored on the server and used for analysis.

- If I use SmartCardio, will emergency personnel or family be able to find me?

Yes. The important people will be able to track the location of the patient through a mobile application. This is done so that in an emergency they can quickly find you.

If SmartCardio is not for you - maybe you have family and friends who can benefit from it? Please share on your Facebook, tweet on Twitter - every share is heartily appreciated! You can share through links at the top this page or through our SmartCardio page. You just might save a life!


Thank you for your interest and support.

story:
Thank you for visiting us!
Click PLAY above and below to watch videos about our project and the work we do or watch on our YouTube Channel
>>8/11/15 NEWSFLASH!!  Special PERK available for a LIMITED TIME.  Help us reach our 25 for $100 goal with our special Swag Bag offer!!

>>8/3/15 NEWSFLASH!!  We made it to $5,000 in time and received our matching donation.  Thank you to our anonomous donor!!>>7/27/15 NEWSFLASH!!  We have received a matching offer for the first $5,000 donated in the next 7 days. Double your dollars and give today!
>>7/26/15 NEWSFLASH!!  We have been selected as the Lowe's Heroes Project recipient for 2015.  They will bring supplies and help on Friday, July 31st to help us get closer to the completion of our buildout.  Your donation matters, help us stretch the contribution from Lowe's and turn this Speedy Mart into a community-based clinic by donating today! 

Click Here to Like us on Facebook
Click Here for Our YouTube Channel
In a city known for its leadership in healthcare and which calls itself home to world-renowned medical experts, the Rainier Valley stands out as a Federally Designated Medically Underserved Community. Living in the Rainier Valley means...
  • You are more likely to die 17 years earlier than people living only a few miles east of here
  • You are more likely than women in the rest of the county to receive care only in the 3rd trimester or no prenatal care at all
  • Your pregnancy is more likely to result in a preterm birth or a very low birth weight baby than the rest of the county
  • If you are a family of color, your baby is twice as likely die as a white baby and is more likely to suffer from health complications for the first year of life

It's time to change the experience of healthcare for families here.  Health providers and community MUST come together to address the fact that health outcomes are dramatically worse in Rainier Valley than those in neighboring communities.  It's time to take lessons from around the globe and apply them locally, creating big changes with relatively low resources.


What we know.
Healthcare models from around the world show when midwives and doctors work together to care for expecting families, health outcomes and families' experiences in the healthcare system improve.  This is a wonderful entry point into a new kind of healthcare engagement, so we are starting with a focus on expecting mothers, women, babies, and children. We believe...
  • Optimal health should never be an unattainable goal
  • Access to healthcare is a fundamental human right 
  • Health providers working together with community educators and families can change the story of a community's health
  • Free and affordable clinic services with business hours on evenings and weekends will allow women to access prenatal care early, often and easily
  • Together, we can welcome more full term healthy babies born into healthier families in our community

                         

Rainier Valley Community Clinic is leading the way in Washington and around the nation.  We are among the first community-based free clinics to offer midwifery-led collaborative care for pregnancy and birth.  Data has shown that when midwives participate in prenatal care, outcomes improve, regardless of the place of birth. This model smooths the path for women to access care from doctors and to birth in the hospital, birth center, or at home.  We also know this kind of care is cost-effective. For example, preventing just one preterm birth saves over $51,000 in NICU and follow-up expenses.

Your contribution directly funds respectful, relationship-centered care that is guided by principles of cultural humility and evidence-based practice.  It helps bring healthy full term babies into thriving families.  It brings providers together to learn with and teach each other in an environment where knowledge from all sources is valued. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We love our volunteers!  Healthcare providers, maintenance and cleaning crews, IT people, reception specialists, interpreters, social media mavens, board members, attorneys, nonprofit gurus, and friends are all valued members of the team and we welcome your involvement!

· Stop on by and see us in action!  We are located at 6061 Martin Luther King Jr Way S, Seattle, WA 98118

·  Email us!  admin@rv-cc.org

·  Visit us online at www.RV-CC.org 

We are proud to be partnered with and have as our fiscal sponsor for this campaign Open Arms Perinatal Services

Since 1997, Open Arms Perinatal Services has been providing strong community-based support for women through pregnancy, birth and postpartum.

“At Open Arms, we believe in the inherent dignity and worth of every mother and baby. We believe in the possibility of every child that is born. And we believe that every mother and every family always have the opportunity to live out that possibility.”

We honor Jennie Joseph, and the work she has done to shine a light on the role that midwifery care can play in public health

Our Community Partners:

We welcome corporate and individual partners to join us in our efforts to eliminate disparities in this community. Thank you to the many businesses and individuals that have helped us to this point with in-kind donations totaling $35,000 :

Andy Hall- Architect
Bala's Plumbing
Chris Corwin
Dunn Lumber
Essential Birth and Family Center
Franz-Gai's Family
Great NW Construction Co.
Karen Dugan, midwife
Lowe's Hero's Project
Viking Electric
Rick Contracting
Retiring physician donating furniture (anonymous)

Thank you to our community organization partners!
Open Arms Perinatal Services
Improving Birth
Families of Color Seattle
Seattle Literacy Council
Fit Foods
Community of Mindful Parents
Listening Mothers
Essential Birth & Family Center

In a city known for its leadership in healthcare and which calls itself home to world-renowned medical experts, the Rainier Valley stands out as a Federally Designated Medically Underserved Community. Living in the Rainier Valley means...

You are more likely to die 17 years earlier than people living only a few miles east of here

You are more likely than women in the rest of the county to receive care only in the 3rd trimester or no prenatal care at all

Your pregnancy is more likely to result in a preterm birth or a very low birth weight baby than the rest of the county

If you are a family of color, your baby is twice as likely die as a white baby and is more likely to suffer from health complications for the first year of life
It's time to change the experience of healthcare for families here.  Health providers and community MUST come together to address the fact that health outcomes are dramatically worse in Rainier Valley than those in neighboring communities.  It's time to take lessons from around the globe and apply them locally, creating big changes with relatively low resources.
What we know. Healthcare models from around the world show when midwives and doctors work together to care for expecting families, health outcomes and families' experiences in the healthcare system improve.  This is a wonderful entry point into a new kind of healthcare engagement, so we are starting with a focus on expecting mothers, women, babies, and children. We believe...
Optimal health should never be an unattainable goal 

Access to healthcare is a fundamental human right  

Health providers working together with community educators and families can change the story of a community's health
Free and affordable clinic services with business hours on evenings and weekends will allow women to access prenatal care early, often and easily
Together, we can welcome more full term healthy babies born into healthier families in our community



                          
Rainier Valley Community Clinic is leading the way in Washington and around the nation.  We are among the first community-based free clinics to offer midwifery-led collaborative care for pregnancy and birth.  Data has shown that when midwives participate in prenatal care, outcomes improve, regardless of the place of birth. This model smooths the path for women to access care from doctors and to birth in the hospital, birth center, or at home.  We also know this kind of care is cost-effective. For example, preventing just one preterm birth saves over $51,000 in NICU and follow-up expenses.Your contribution directly funds respectful, relationship-centered care that is guided by principles of cultural humility and evidence-based practice.  It helps bring healthy full term babies into thriving families.  It brings providers together to learn with and teach each other in an environment where knowledge from all sources is valued.  
Other
Ways You Can Help
We love our volunteers!  Healthcare providers, maintenance and cleaning crews, IT people, reception specialists, interpreters,
social media mavens, board members, attorneys, nonprofit gurus, and friends are
all valued members of the team and we welcome your involvement! 
· Stop on by and see us in action!  We are located at 6061 Martin Luther King Jr
Way S, Seattle, WA 98118
·  Email us!  admin@rv-cc.org
·  Visit us online at www.RV-CC.org  


We are proud to be partnered with and have as
our fiscal sponsor for this campaign Open Arms Perinatal Services 


Since 1997, Open Arms Perinatal Services has been providing
strong community-based support for women through pregnancy, birth and
postpartum.
“At Open Arms, we believe in the inherent dignity and worth
of every mother and baby. We believe in the possibility of every child that is
born. And we believe that every mother and every family always have the
opportunity to live out that possibility.”
We
honor Jennie Joseph,
and the work she has done to shine a light on the role that midwifery care can
play in public healthOur
Community Partners:

We welcome corporate and individual partners to join us in
our efforts to eliminate disparities in this community. Thank you to the many businesses and individuals that have helped us to this point with in-kind donations totaling $35,000 :Andy Hall- ArchitectBala's PlumbingChris CorwinDunn LumberEssential Birth and Family CenterFranz-Gai's FamilyGreat NW Construction Co.Karen Dugan, midwifeLowe's Hero's ProjectViking ElectricRick ContractingRetiring physician donating furniture (anonymous) Thank you to our community organization partners!Open Arms Perinatal ServicesImproving BirthFamilies of Color SeattleSeattle Literacy CouncilFit FoodsCommunity of Mindful ParentsListening MothersEssential Birth & Family Center

story:
HELP !!!

Our friend Pece Rogovski, is 31 years old.  Now his destiny is in our hands, because He is alone with his mother and they are both unemployed, so he really needs help from us all.  Few months ago He was diagnosed cancer and after a weeks of chemotherapy and chirurgical operation we all hoped that it is over.  But a week ago He started to have pain in bones, and after some tests doctors found that cancer has spreaded in spinal canal and on spinal cord so He will have to go on beam therapy which costs around 3000 euros and after that surgery is needed, because none of our doctors wants to do it, which costs around 35000 euros.  He is good man and always was good to people, but life was not easy to Him.
So PLEASE lets show Him that there are still good people, that's not everything black in this world and give him opportunity to fight this illnes and hope everything will be ok.

story:
(Please watch the video above)

A profound and glaring need...

Hi.  My name is Brandon.  I’m a recovering addict.

Thanks to working the 12 steps, I have been sober from drugs and alcohol for over 2 years.  I’m very fortunate to live in a place with regular 12 step meetings.  Others are not so lucky.  Many cannot access meetings at all.  And still others who live in places with frequent meetings cannot attend when they need it most.

Wecovery addresses this profound and glaring need by offering recovering addicts access to the power of a 12 step meeting at any time from anywhere.

The idea is simple.  Wecovery is an app that resides on a person’s phone.  A recovering addict in need of a meeting can use the app to share about their current situation just as they would in a 12 step meeting.  Then they can choose to listen to other addicts’ shares and relate to them, reminding them that they are not alone.

Addiction is an isolating disease.  12 step recovery offers a collective solution, based on interpersonal connections.

Wecovery forges these connections across the globe, putting the power of a 12 step meeting in a person’s pocket.

You have the opportunity to shape human history, helping to fight the scourge of addiction on a scale that has never before been possible.  Whether your own life has been touched by this disease or you want to be part of a positive movement with the potential to impact millions of lives, please join me.

We’re all in this together.


Answers

Here are the answers to some questions you may have.  If you have a question you don’t see the answer to below, please feel free to contact me at brandonp@wecovery.org


Funding

  • Why would I support Wecovery if I’m not an addict?

Chances are, you know and care for someone who is struggling with addiction.  According to the 2010 National Survey on Drug Use and Health, 23.5 million Americans are addicted to alcohol and drugs.  That’s approximately 1 in every 10 Americans over the age of 12.  And that’s only substance addictions.  Taking into account all other addictions, the percentage of the population becomes staggeringly high.

Even in the off chance that you don’t personally know an addict, you have the opportunity to be a part of something that can truly help people on a tremendous scale.  Addiction had plagued humankind for centuries.  Now, using the power of technology, we can come together to fight it in a way that has never before been possible.  Who wouldn’t want to be a part of human history?

  • What is the funding for?

Your contributions will go towards the development, marketing, and initial launch of the app.  The more expensive items include:

o  Coding / programming

o  Functionality and layout

o  User experience design

o  Marketing

o  Secure data warehousing

  • May I contribute anonymously?

Yes, simply write "Anonymous" in the name field.  Thank you for your contribution!

  • How will Wecovery make money?

The purpose of Wecovery is not to make money but to get this tool into the hands of the people who need it as soon as possible.  Your contributions are essential to making that happen.

As the Wecovery community grows, we will look to more traditional means of monetization to support and sustain the app’s maintenance and growth.

There are no plans to charge users for the app.  We hope to provide Wecovery for free to the people who need it.

  • This seems like a good candidate for venture capital.  Why not go that route?

We may, if we cannot raise adequate funding on Indiegogo.  But venture capital comes with strings attached.  And the biggest string is an emphasis on profitability.  Again, Wecovery is about helping people who are struggling from addiction.  This is our primary purpose.  We’d rather not muddy that.

  • I can’t afford to contribute, but I’d still like to help.

No worries!  Please help by getting the word out and sharing this campaign with your personal network.  You can post on Facebook, Twitter, or by using the Indiegogo share tools.  And if you’re in recovery, please feel free to mention this campaign to your fellows.


How Wecovery works

  • What types of addiction will Wecovery.org support?

Wecovery.org will support people suffering from all types of addictions – from alcohol and drugs, to sex and gambling, to codependency and overeating.  Addiction is addiction is addiction.  That is why only one of the 12 steps mentions the addicts’ specific addiction.  If you are working a 12 step program, Wecovery is meant to help you, whatever your addiction may be.

  • Does this mean I will have to hear shares that aren’t relevant to my situation?

People will be able to self-identify their addictions and to categorize their shares by addiction.  So, if you are an alcoholic you can sort by shares from other alcoholics, etc.

  • What about trolls?

Trolls are an unfortunate nuisance in any online community.  This community will be self-policed, meaning that people will be able to flag shares that have inappropriate content or “cross talk.”  Flagged shares will be reviewed by the folks at Wecovery and taken down if they are in violation of the community’s basic rules.

  • What is “cross talk?”

Cross talk is defined as referring to or commenting on what another person has shared.

  • Will members be able to “like” someone else’s share?

No.  This is not Facebook.  The point of Wecovery is for addicts to share sincerely from the heart like they would in real meetings.  Adding “likes,” or “views,” or the number of “shares” may encourage inauthenticity – and that wouldn’t help anyone.

Members will, however, be able to “share a share” with someone else in the community if they feel a friend can relate to it.  As mentioned above, the number of times a share is shared will not be visible.

  • Is Wecovery affiliated with AA?

Wecovery is not affiliated with Alcoholics Anonymous or any other 12 step program. We are grateful to AA and the other 12 step fellowships for the services they provide.

  • Is Wecovery meant to replace in-person meetings?

No.  Nothing can replace the magic that happens during an in-person meeting.  Wecovery is meant to supplement it, and to offer an option for folks who can’t make a meeting when they really need one.


Privacy and anonymity concerns

  • What if someone recognizes my voice or identity?

For addicts who are worried about this, there will be an option to alter the tone of your voice.

However, the chances of your coworkers, clergymen, or neighbors trying to find you on Wecovery are akin to them showing up outside your next 12 step meeting to see who walks in the door.

  • Will members be able to delete their shares if they wish?

Yes, members will be able to access and delete their past shares if they would like to do so.

  • Won’t people be ashamed to have a recovery app on their phones?

Secrecy and shame are two of addiction’s greatest weapons.  Recovering from addiction is one of the hardest things a person can do in life.  It is something to be proud of.  Wecovery is meant to lend a voice to the people struggling in the shadows, to give them a sense of pride in their miraculous accomplishments, and to dissolve the power of shame and secrecy.

  • What personal information is required?

The only information you are required to provide is a first name and last initial.  Ideally, these will be real, but you are free to use any name.  We want to make it as easy as possible for recovering addicts to sign up and get the help they need.

We will ask that you voluntarily identify your addiction, sobriety date, and location so we can keep track of our community to best respond to its specific needs.


The 12 steps

  • I thought 12 step groups don’t work, that people in them don’t stay sober.

Incorrect.  We’ve seen hundreds of men and women who have been freed from the shackles of addiction by going to meetings and working the 12 steps of recovery.  Just like with everything else in life, you get out of it what you put in.  Or, in 12 step vernacular, “It works if you work it.”  Wecovery offers a tool to help recovering addicts work it.

You may know people who have gone to 12 step meetings and gotten sober for a period of time “only to relapse.”  It’s unfortunate that this is viewed as failure.  What about the period of time during which the addict stayed clean?  Any single sober day for an addict is a miracle in itself.  12 step programs deliver these miracles on a daily basis all over the world.

  • Aren’t 12 step groups religious?

No.  12 step groups are not affiliated with any religion.  In the 2nd Step, recovering addicts “Came to believe that a power greater than ourselves could restore us to sanity.”  This Higher Power need only be something that is not the addict’s self-will.  Often, it is the group itself- in AA, folks frequently quip that GOD stands for Group of Drunks.  For others with more religious backgrounds, a Higher Power may take on a more traditional image of God according to their religious traditions.  Every 12 step group member is encouraged to define his or her own version of spirituality.

  • Where can I find more information on the 12 steps?

Here’s a good starting point: http://www.12step.org/


Finally, to quote Mother Teresa:

At the end of life we will not be judged by how many diplomas we have received, how much money we have made, how many great things we have done.
We will be judged by "I was hungry, and you gave me something to eat, I was naked and you clothed me. I was homeless, and you took me in.”

This is your opportunity to make a difference.  Please take it.

Thank you for your service.

story:
Let me introduce to you our wonderful boy Wojtus (spelled Voytus).
 
Voytus is our long expected only child, the sparkle in our lives, the miracle that we cherish.

We started off like any other young couple, full of hope and joy. The world belonged to us. We dreamed about a big family, yet it seemed that faith didn't plan it this way. We have been waiting for a child for very long. After four years of tension and dissapointment in failed attempts, we were about to lose the last hope that we could ever be parents, and then, the miracle!

We were having a baby. We couldn't believe our luck, the happines rocketed, we were so excited! We couldn't wait to hold our litle baby in our arms. The time flew, 9 months after Voytus come into this world. And this is where the journey began.


Unfortunately few hours after he came to this world, he was diagnozed with a life threatening heart defect. Open heart surgery and multpile threatments have not been able to remove the defect entirely. Voytus has been disqualified for further threatment in Poland due to the level of complicity of the defect.

Since the day Voytus was born, our lives are arranged around constant hospital visits and consultations with specialists. Voytus' heart suffers from Ventricular Septal Defect (VSD), Major Aortopulmonary Collateral Artery (MAPCAS) and Angina Pectoris (AP), Tricuspid Atresia.

Voytus was born 15th of December 2013 in Boleslawiec, Poland. The complications with his health started within the first hours of his short life. After first assesments he received 10 points on Apgar scale, however shortly after that the color of his skin terrified us and the doctors recognized that his body was obviously lacking oxygene, significant decrease in saturation was discovered. He had to be attached to respiratory machinery. This same day Voytus had been transported to another hospital where the heart defect has been diagnozed.

 On 23.12.2013 in Zabrze (Poland) he had a major surgery on open heart. Unfortunately the desired result was not achieved. Another necessary operation was done on 27.01.2014. This time an improvement was achieved, Voytus could finally start eating from bottle, instead of a tube. He started gaining strenght, but in the meantime it turned out that other problems appeared. He had to be operated again due to lack of pulse in his dorsalis pedis artery (dorsal artery of foot).

Voytus spent another 2 months in hospital in Wroclaw. On 05.02.2014 He was qualified for further surgical treatment and placed on a waiting list of 3 months. The surgery on 15.05.2014 was unsuccessful. Doctor did not manage to expand the artery and Voytus was dismissed form the hospital with another apointment date 6 months later.

17.11.2014 two catheterization and angioplasty procedures were carried out again in Zabrze. This time Voytus spent 2 weeks in the hospital. I will add that all the institutions where Voytus was treated are spread around the country, so in addition to our already harsh financial situation, we spent a fortune on travelling and accommodation.

On 16.12.2014 heart tomography was done in order to decide on the further development of the treatment. After numerous consultations Voytus has been disqualified from further treatment in Poland due to overly complicated nature of his heart defect. There is simply no equipment and specialists in Poland to help our son.

We have been given contact details to a university hospital in Germany, Munster, where profesor Edward Malec, worldwide recognized specialist, agreed to operate.

Unfortunately the cost of this operation is 36.500 EUR (approx 40.000 USD) plus the accomodation for at least one of us, in Germany.

This treatment is absolutely unachivable for us without help from outside.

We realise that it is a lot to ask, to seek help from complete strangers but for us this is literally a matter of life and death. We must do everything that is in our capacity to make it work. We cannot let anything bad happen to Voytus.  We cannot bare the thought of a failure in our quest and we cannot rest without having exhausted every possible channel, and having knocked every door, to help our son.

Our little boy's life is in our hands and in hands of good people.

Please support, every cent will be of huge help, and we are grateful from the bottom of our hearts for your kindness.

If you are not able to support our cause financially, please share it in your social media, to spread the word. This will also be a tremendous help.



Szymon, Katarzyna and Wojtus (Voytus) ZakrzewskiShort Summary

oxygene, significant decrease in saturation was discovered. He had to
be attached to respiratory machinery. This same day Voytus had been
transported to another hospital where the heart defect has been
diagnozed. 

 On
23.12.2013 in Zabrze (Poland) he had a major surgery on open heart.
Unfortunately the desired result was not achieved. Another necessary
operation was done on 27.01.2014. This time an improvement was
achieved, Voytus could finally start eating from bottle, instead of a
tube. He started gaining strenght, but in the meantime it turned out
that other problems appeared. He had to be operated again due to lack
of pulse in his dorsalis pedis artery (dorsal artery of foot).
Voytus
spent another 2 months in hospital in Wroclaw. On 05.02.2014 He was
qualified for further surgical treatment and placed on a waiting list
of 3 months. The surgery on 15.05.2014 was unsuccessful. Doctor did
not manage to expand the artery and Voytus was dismissed form the
hospital with another apointment date 6 months later.
17.11.2014
two catheterization and angioplasty procedures were carried out again
in Zabrze. This time Voytus spent 2 weeks in the hospital. I will add
that all the institutions where Voytus was treated are spread around
the country, so in addition to our already harsh financial situation,
we spent a fortune on travelling and accommodation. 

On
16.12.2014 heart tomography was done in order to decide on the
further development of the treatment. After numerous consultations
Voytus has been disqualified from further treatment in Poland due to
overly complicated nature of his heart defect. There is simply no
equipment and specialists in Poland to help our son.
We
have been given contact details to a university hospital in Germany,
Munster, where profesor Edward Malec, worldwide recognized
specialist, agreed to operate.
Unfortunately
the cost of this operation is 36.500 EUR (approx 40.000 USD) plus the
accomodation for at least one of us, in Germany.
This
treatment is absolutely unachivable for us without help from outside.


We
realise that it is a lot to ask, to seek help from complete strangers
but for us this is literally a matter of life and death. We must do
everything that is in our capacity to make it work. We cannot let
anything bad happen to Voytus.  We cannot bare the thought of a
failure in our quest and we cannot rest without having exhausted
every possible channel, and having knocked every door, to help our
son.Our little boy's life is in our hands and in hands of
good people. Please support, every cent will be of huge help,
and we are grateful from the bottom of our hearts for your
kindness. If you are not able to support our cause financially, please share it in your social media, to spread the word. This will also be a tremendous help.
Szymon, Katarzyna and Wojtus (Voytus)
ZakrzewskiShort Summary

story:
Who We Are


Mission: Tell My Daughters exists to support healing for survivors of sexual assault.  Born out of necessity, TMD provides a space for those seeking a stronghold. We have made it our task to ensure the empowerment ofeach survivor we meet, so that the next generation of women learn to live unafraid, and unabashedly aware of their worth. 

Ethos:Tell My Daughters to surround themselves with the brave and the bold. To choose friends who are unashamed to be exactly who they are. Friends who will cultivate creativity and kindness. Friends, alongside whom, she will chase her most wild dreams. We must tell them the truth: they must know that they will struggle.  Each of us carries something heavy in our souls.  But when they are truly known by someone, they will never be alone, even in their darkest days. 


What We Need

Tell My Daughters is in its genesis. We are working tirelessly to make this community space possible for women everywhere. Our dream is to provide resources, give voice, and fight for the safety and empowerment of all women. 
To build a strong foundation to support the work ahead for the 2015-2016 year of operating costs we are fundraising to not let another day go by that this resource isn't available to survivors. 

Here's a breakdown of the costs ahead + how we need you. 

Operational + Organization Development: $45,000 
  • Management 
  • Operations 
  • Domain + Web Support 
  • Continued Web Development 
Community Development: $5,000
We are are building TMD to be the first online space created specifically for survivors of sexual assault around the world. 
  • The build out of an online database of healing resources.
  • Support staff composed of editors + writers to develop the online community
Fall 2015 Survivor Dinner: $5,000 
Official launch of Tell My Daughters hosting 50 survivors and 50 advocates from around the nation for one night in Nashville, TN. 

Policy + Lobbying Establishment: $5,000
Recently, US Senator Tim Kaine (D-Va.) sponsored the Teach Safe Relationships Act into Congress. This Bill would amend the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (ESEA) to authorize the Secretary of Education to award competitive four-year grants to local educational agencies (LEAs) to provide: (1) professional development to school administrators, teachers, and staff in safe relationship behavior education; and (2) educational programming and curricula for students regarding safe relationship behavior.
Funds will be allocated towards building relationships on Capitol Hill to see how Tell My Daughters can help further this bill becoming a reality in the education system.


Other Ways You Can Help

More than anything our goal is to make sure that survivors know this community space exists for them. If you are unable to donate monetarily at this time, the most powerful way to join us is by sharing www.tellmydaughters.com with your friends, family and social networks. We hope you will join us!

With wholehearted gratitude, 

Abigail Goodrich

story:
Short Summary

Flood Water Roller Derby needs a home and YOU can help!

For the past 4 years the Flood has been practicing in a facility too small to bout in.  As the league continues to expand it is becoming more obvious that we have outgrown our space.  We currently have a real estate agent looking into new venues for the team, but a bigger space is going to be a more expensive place.  Here is where you come in…


What We Need & What You Get

Flood Water Roller Derby (FWRD) has been around for years, but has never had a home bout.  (Crazy, right?!)  Every time we compete we have to drive to our rival's turf.  All those away games aren't great for recruiting new skaters and makes it hard on our fans. 

So...

Do you want to watch exciting action packed derby bouts right here in Roseville?  Do you want to support local female athletes?  Do you like cool stuff?  

Awesome! 

Donate to our Indiegogo Fund and help us get established in a larger facility.  

Check out our perks and score yourself some swag.  It will let people know you are a true derby fan! 


What the heck is Flood Water Roller Derby?

We are so glad you asked!

FWRD is a 501c3 non-profit organization dedicated to empowering women and children in the community. As a competitive sports league we are working to compete on an international level. As a non-profit organization we intend to ultimately donate 50% of our profits to other local non-profits.

Formed in 2012, FWRD set out to create a truly democratic roller derby league with the ultimate goal of competing in international women's flat track derby as part of the Women's Flat Track Derby Association (WFTDA).  

In order to compete in WFTDA, a league must have a regulation home bouting facility, or track. That is what we are hoping to find and why we need your help!


The Impact

Not only will you be bringing bouts closer to home than ever before, but you will also be supporting female athletes right here in Roseville! 

As a league we are home to marketing geniuses, fitness professionals, artists, entrepreneurs, teachers, military personnel and mothers.  Over the years we have seen women transform their lives through the empowerment of participation. Help us continue to make a difference in our community and have fun at the same time.

story:
INTRODUCING



HIGH QUALITY HEADPHONES TO MATCH YOUR STYLE


Light Weight, Color Customizable, Epic Design, Amazing Sound


ECHOLOCATION is revolutionizing the traditional form factor of headphones by infusing a lightweight, retro future design with color customizable ear pads and audiophile quality sound.



QUALITY, COLOR, COMFORT, DURABILITY


Designed to provide the best quality sound possible in the smallest, most unobtrusive form factor.


ECHOLOCATION headphones are most distinguished by a unique form language, material selection, and the ability to color customize according to personal taste.


ECHOLOCATION headphones combine high quality audio with a refined, minimalist aesthetic. All unnecessary complexity has been removed, resulting in a product that has been perfectly optimized and reduced to it's absolute essential elements.



High fidelity headphones embracing the inevitable merging of technology, design, and fashion.



DURABLE

A variety of contrasting materials have been chosen including silicone, brushed stainless steel, and high gloss plastic, giving ECHOLOCATION headphones a classic contemporary look and feel.


Our headband is composed of a combination of stainless steel and silicone, able to withstand accidental drops without cracking.

Unlike other headphones composed of fabric ear pads that deteriorate very quickly, ECHOLOCATION headphones are made from silicone resulting in a product that is extremely resilient, long lasting, and customizable.


CUSTOMIZABLE

ECHOLOCATION headphones are designed to be easily color customizable according to your personal taste. Simply remove the silicone ear pads and replace with the color of your choice. Our color palette includes dark blue, light blue, green, yellow, red, and pink. Ear pads are small and light weight, making them easy to carry in your bag or pocket for customization on the go.

Since the silicone ear pads are easily removable and easy to clean, you can swap color choices with friends as you grow your epic collection.


COMFORTABLE

The clamping force of ECHOLOCATION headphones has been tuned according to ergonomic data so that they do not put too much pressure on the ears during use. Silicone ear pads are surprisingly soft to the touch and have been designed to form an air cushion around the ear for optimal sound, passive noise cancellation, and comfort.


Size and weight have been kept to a minimum so that our headphones do not feel bulky or heavy. Our headband has been designed to allow for a wide range of adjustment.


HIGH QUALITY AUDIO

ECHOLOCATION headphones have been designed without any compromise in sound quality. With a frequency response of 20 Hz - 20kHz our carefully selected 40mm drivers deliver surprisingly clear, balanced, and accurate sound with striking clarity and a powerful deep base response.





VERSATILITY

Perfect for your next work out or daily commute. Durable, light weight construction combined with a carefully tuned clamping force results in headphones that won't feel distracting or fall off accidentally. Listen to your favorite music, pod cast, or audio book on the go.




COMPATIBILITY

ECHOLOCATION headphones are compatible with all Apple devices as well as most Android and Windows devices.

An in-line three button microphone works when answering calls and also functions as play, pause, next track, previous track, and volume control.



TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS

DRIVER SIZE - 40mm
TRANSDUCER PRINCIPLE - dynamic, closed
IMPEDANCE - 32 Ohms
FREQUENCY RESPONSE - 20 Hz - 20 kHz
SOUND PRESSURE LEVEL - 120 dB
TOTAL HARMONIC DISTORTION - < 0.5%
DIMENSIONS - 7.5 x 6.25 x 2.5 inches
CABLE LENGTH - 48 inches
WEIGHT - 4.9 ounces



TIMELINE



THE TEAM

NICHOLAS OXLEY | CEO (NYC)

With more than a decade of product development experience, Nicholas has successfully brought well over one hundred products to market. He is listed on numerous design and engineering patents and has worked with many of the worlds top product development firms.

He is a designer, engineer, entrepreneur, pragmatist, connoisseur, and by his own admission, still in love with the creative process and the joy of seeing new ideas come to life. With an undergraduate degree in Mechanical Engineering from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology as well as a Master of Arts degree from the Royal College of Art, Nicholas brings a holistic approach to his work drawing upon a diverse background in design and engineering.

In 2010, Nicholas founded independent DSGN PRJCT as a means for exploring the limits of technology, materials, and manufacturing. His personal work has since been shown at many galleries and exhibitions around the world. ECHOLOCATION grew out of a desire to build an innovative brand focused on the emerging market for wearable and portable consumer electronics.

nicholas@echolocation.nyc


ADAM ARON | CFO (NYC)

Combining expertise in finance, engineering and design, Adam brings a multi-dimensional perspective to ECHOLOCATION that uniquely enables him to contribute to both the financial and creative growth of the company.

After graduating from the University of Wisconsin with a degree in Mechanical Engineering, he began his career designing numerous components for mobile handsets as well as managing tool design and manufacturing processes. Four years later, in search of a new challenge, Adam earned an MBA from The University of Chicago with a focus on finance, strategy, entrepreneurship, and accounting. This lead him to a decade long career in finance. Adam is a Chartered Financial Analyst.

adam@echolocation.nyc


FAQ

What is in the box? A standard set of headphones comes with grey silicone ear pads as well as a convenient carry case. Different colored ear pads can be purchased separately according to your personal taste.

What are the specific measurements of the headband? The headband is 7.5 inches tall, 6.25 inches wide, and 0.5 inch in depth.

Are they wireless or Bluetooth enabled? Not yet... We have made every attempt to keep the product as lightweight, unobtrusive, and aesthetically refined as possible. Wireless functionality would require adding weight, increasing the overall size, and raising the price point.

Do you have a plan for incorporating Bluetooth capability? Approximately when? Assuming that we reach our campaign goal and the brand becomes successful, our next generation product will very likely have Bluetooth capability. The product we are currently launching with will remain a wired set of headphones.

What's the best advisable method for cleaning and maintaining my earpads? The ear pads can be thoroughly cleaned with a mild cleanser (hand or dish soap) and water, then dried before replacing. Also, they can be wiped with a damp cloth for a quick clean without removing.

How do silicone ear pads compare to other materials on the market? Unlike other headphones composed of fabric ear pads that deteriorate very quickly, ECHOLOCATION headphones are made from silicone resulting in a product that is resilient and long lasting. Silicone ear pads are extremely durable, will not absorb moisture, and can be removed for cleaning. Silicone ear pads are surprisingly soft to the touch and have been designed to form an air cushion around the ear for optimal sound and comfort.

Are they compatible with Apple, Android, and Windows devices?ECHOLOCATION headphones are compatible with all Apple devices as well as most Android and Windows devices.

How do I change the color of the ear pads? Silicone is an elastomeric material that will easily stretch around the speaker housing for a secure fit. The attachment is made without the use of any fasteners or snaps. Simply peel away the silicone ear pads and replace with the color of your choice.

What are the ear pad color options? Our color palette includes, dark blue, light blue, green, yellow, red, and pink.

How is the sound quality? ECHOLOCATION headphones have been designed without any compromise to sound quality. With a frequency response of 20Hz - 20kHz, our carefully selected 40mm drivers deliver surprisingly clear, balanced, and accurate sound with striking clarity and a powerful deep base response.

Will they fit my head? Yes! Informed by ergonomic data, our headband has been designed to allow for a wide range of adjustment.

Are microphone and remote control features included? Yes! An in-line three button microphone works when answering calls and also functions as play, pause, next track, previous track, and volume control.

How long is the cable? 48 inches.

When will I receive my headphones? We are doing our best to have ECHOLOCATION products shipping to you as soon as possible. We will provide continuous updates about the production schedule during and after the campaign.

What is the warranty? We provide a one year limited warranty and guarantee that you receive ECHOLOCATION products free of manufacturing defects.

Can I change or cancel my perk? Indiegogo has now made it easier than ever to upgrade your perks. You can now do so on the contributions tab of your Indiegogo profile. See more information on how to do this here:

https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/526756-How-to-Upgrade-Your-Perk

Refunds prior to the end of the campaign will be processed by emailing:

support@indiegogo.com

After the campaign, Indiegogo policy dictates that campaign owners have no ability to adjust perk selections nor are we obliged to cancel or refund a perk.

How is shipping handled? We will be shipping via the United States Postal Service First Class mail with delivery tracking confirmation. International shipments will be sent via International First Class mail.

How much is shipping and handling? Shipping and handling, which includes shipping the items to our offices, packing, and fulfilling orders.

Shipping varies by perk. Single headphone perk shipping costs:

FREE in the Domestic United States (including Hawaii, Puerto Rico, Alaska)

$5 to Canada

$25 for International Orders

LINK TO THANK YOU REWARDS PROGRAM
